refuse to accept medical scoffing at realizing the importance of the following....I know it is what has cleared my scans & brought my TM's down---and they were a mess, no joke.  My numbers were almost on the moon, but now:   CEA-- 2.1, CA15 -- 42, and the CA27-29 is 72...all this just since last June.   Can't tell me it's the Femara or Aromasin alone....so please, start today:  Get GreenGiant Asparagus, bring to boil, cool, puree, and take 2-3 tblsp twice daily.  Many people do this and you will be surprised how it "eats" organ/body tumors.   I take the following supplements:   DIM or Indole3/Carbinole....it is the same chemical makeup as Tamoxifin, only in the natural veg state (before they add the poisons), I take 400mg,( you can buy either DIM or Indole, I take the Indole and find the Pure label the best).  You must be on Iodine if you have any radiation, will neutralize and stablize free radicals in the body and keep damage to your immune system to minimum, that is what ends up killing us, our immune system becomes overwhelmed w/chemo poision and DNA breaks down.  Fucoidan or U-FN is a natural brown seaweed, actually eats cancer cells.   Calcium 500mg, Magnesium, Vitamin C, D3- at least 2000mg.       Curcumin/Tumeric--  don't underestimate the power of Curcumin/Tumeric, amazing!   Zinc, Flaxseed/Omega 3, best to use the vegetable over the fish oil as many omega fishoils made from the organs of fish where toxins accumulate.   I am taking Vit B17 aka Laetrile, I eat maybe 10 apricot seedpits daily as well.  Best to  keep your body PH alkaline, avoid sugars, milk, glutemates, soy (0nly fermented soy after cancer), try to eat only whole natural foods, vegs, fruits, limit red meat and avoid caffeine, sugary drinks, etc.   I am very anti chemotheraphy, after reading that 85% of polled onocologists said they would refuse chemo, plus stats show no real reduction in cancer success in over 50 yrs, only in how they post number, time to do my own research.   I also know that refusing traditional surgery (mastectomy & lymph removal) saved me from being in the ditch.   I had laser surgery, seals the blood and fluids from traveling in the body to set up housekeeping when we least expect it.   We have to be our own advocates.  I've lost 4 dear friends, watched them go thru this misery and now I visit them in the cemetary.   I refuse to accept only what doctors say, they always have that eye roll thing going when I ask "impertinent" questions", been told i'd never see my next birthday if I didn't have chemo, but here I am, birthday behind me.   We have to insist they listen to us and treat us like living breathing children of God, not a number on a file folder.     We're all on borrowed time but i'm going to stretch mine as far as I can.   Please feel free to email meewa@tds.net if you like and I will be happy to send you links  to these sites so you can read for yourself.  Also where you can purchase.   These are not hocus pocus cures, or as one of my "fired" radiologists said "vooddoo witchdoctor" remedies.   These are scientific studied sites with proven records, i'm not into grasping at straws, many on this site will tell you, chemo is not our friend, neither is radiation, but what choice do they give us?  I personally refused, once used, can't make that journey again.   We can win, i've got dear friend at MGH with recurrence after 20 yrs,  she is doing great.  Don't let anyone yank your chain, if you feel bad after the Aredia, ask if something else availble, but I have a sneaky suspicion it's the Femara, I thought it was the Zometa infusion giving me fits, but it was  Femara that turned out to be the witch in the closet.  We each have to chart our own course, I've chosen mine and don't in any way want to say my way is right, it is right for me, I see the positive results, I see my friends with not so positive results following medical course, so I have to do what my conscience dictates....I send only the best of wishes to you and prayers for an end to this beast who feels free to invade our body.    Stay strong and know others do care.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Tam, be sure to google Fucoidan...the naturodoc site is pretty good, i've used their products and also Doctor's Best Brand.   So glad you have a good nutritionist to assist you.  I've learned so much and knowing cancer is not bacterial or viral, it is anaerobic, tells me we should all be given more instruction in nutrition. We must repair our immune system to fight this awful pest.  I've gotten good results, we both have same Dx ERpos, so hope you have good outcome as well.   I know many believe only drugs can help, but we see chemo isn't the great healing remedy they tout either, at least we know natural won't make us feel like we've just been run over by a tanker truck!   Stay strong, sending much cheer your way.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: At Stage 4,BC, i'm on only the monthly Xgeva shot and daily Aromasin since last December,had been on Femara and Zometa since previous June, 2011; switched Christmas 2011 due to horrid bone pain, fatigue and hottie sweats.  Much improved since switching,  know it's only been couple mo's and as we know, things can change!    recvd such good news on my last CTscan (Feb,'12) showing organ mets have disappeared, can't complain.  I was a total mess w/mets in thyroid, liver,lungs, basal cell carcinoma on scalp (excised), and the bone mets in pelvis, ribs and spine.   Now only tiny spot in spine....so i'm hoping it will be gone by end of summer when next CT scan scheduled (Aug or Sept).   I do feel lots of progress due to the supplements...don't undervalue their importance in boosting your immune system to defeat the beast.   I know without doubt the Indole, Curcumin, and Fucoidan are defeating those little nasty c-cells, also keep your body PH alkaline.  Cancer cannot thrive in alkalinity, ditch the sugars, day by day we can get stronger and make our body enviornment unfriendly to c-cells.   Sending all the best and good wishes for you, we are better than this scourge and I know we can beat it.  Keep posting, we all need to support one another.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Hi, sending u sort of lengthy msg by private....have tried the Avemar, but very expensive.  I just do Flaxseed and wheat germ by adding to all foods, mashed pots, muffins, cereals, etc.  Tho not fermented, still much benefit at very low cost.  The Woeb/N is joint help, think it is a diuretic, helps keep fluids from accumulating around joints.  I just stick w/Excedrin when I have the joint pain, or the ancient remedy - go out on back deck and scream, or kick side of a tree....helps me!   Seriously, stick with whole foods, purified water, good "sensical" nutrient supplements.   We have to research, somuch out there touting great cures, but all any of the supplements do are boost fighting power of our immune system, so big secret is to keep a very healthy body, which in turn keeps immune system healthy, which in turn can repair our fractured DNA which is producing the cancer cells rather than healthy cells.   Feed our body/cells the healthy whole fruits/vegs nutrients so they can overtake the ills.    Don't spend your money on expensive, most vitamins are good even if cheap, just might have to take twice as many as they aren't as potent, just do little research, but spending more isn't going to get you more, tho do look for a reputable company....I like  Dr's Best and Pure and also many of the Swanson vit's, tho many are just as good.    Sending cheer.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: HI, i'm taking Xgeva which is Denosumab.  Had been on Zometa previously, but like Xgeva; so much easier, quick injection to tummy, can hardly feel it, no se's as of yet.   I think I earlier mentioned  needed blood work for renal/kidney function...no, not necessary, doesn't interfere w/kidneys, so that's a plus.   Now I can cut out the extra doc visit for blood work, just go once mo for blood work and shot all at same visit.     If i'm reading info right, Xgeva(denosumab) has receptors that look for the cancer in the bone, cut blood supply and thus destroys cancer, then bone can rebuild healthy bone, so looks like more in the plus column than the minus....I do still have bone pain, but you know, I think the real culprit is Femara.  I went out of town for few days and forgot to take the Femara, man did I ever start to feel good, hot flashes subsided, less fatigue, no bone breaking aches, but so much for that fun, returned home and had to get back on it.   Now i'm ouching all over again...so, I dont think you will find any neg's on the denosumab, or won't be any worse than anything else.   I'm so pleased my tumor markers are going south, CEA levels only 2.7 now which is below the norm of 3.4, and the CA-15 down to 78, and CA25 down to 100...still a way to go, but that is a BIG drop since June.   Scans show tumors/splatterspots have disappeared, only one to work on in the spine, but it has been reduced....so let's hope we are having this discomfort with a big payoff at the end...I'm Stg4BC, but in bigger boat on small lake, which before was a tinsy boat in stormy North Atlantic....Sending big cheers to all of my fellow buds out there.   Smile, we can beat this beast!
Posts.Title: denosomab for bone mets

Posts.Content: Hi Grace, big hello here.  You really have been yanked around.  So thankful you averted an unnecessary surgery.  I do hope I don't sound anti-med/doctors - we've all had that rather "unkind" experience, sometimes made to feel we are inferior beings w/no brain.  Doctor knows all and unless you cooperate, they aren't too concerened w/care.   It's happened, I know, but then there are staff and doctors who do go out of their way, overall, we have to be our own advocates.  WE know our body better than anyone....and, do any of you feel that it's "Slide Card/Tab" medicine today????  Remember the cards with problem, then you slide the tab up or down, match the color for the solution???   Seems that's what medicine is today, tell the symptom, they slide the tab and give you what the card shows for medicine and treatment.   I'm bit older, I remember when doctors actually "touched" their patients, started at the head, looked in your eyes, ears, throat, felt back/front neck, rotated arms, legs, full body, looked at your tongue, your hands, mashed your fingers/fingernails, now it's lucky they look at your face....or, is it me???   Cancer for sure would need more than a quick readout, know on day I got the Dx, it was immediate:  Off with the breast, out w/the lymph nodes, chemo/radiation, then reconstruction....hey, give me a minute to digest that I have cancer! - And, it's your fault!  You (medical) misread, or didn't read, the mammogram and said all clear, now herding me like cattle into a bin!   No matter what or how we got here, we are here.   Think we all agree no matter what therapy we choose, we must keep our body in best shape possible w/nutrition/diet/supplements and healthy lifestyle.  Grace, Do want to say thank you for all your service to cancer patients during your working career w/oncologist.   I can only imagine what an impact seeing so many suffer has made on your life, then to be hit with the "beast" adding harshness, tho glad you are here to share, always give any health tips, I hope every day to learn something new.  Still trying to learn more re: Anaerobic disease.  Had wondered what cancer is, then finding what it isn't - Virus or Bacterial, wondered how you fight it, it's a very strange disease.  Read "Emperor of All Maladies" a biography of cancer.   Reinforces our path of diet and nutrition.  It is the key.  Only one renegade cell can go haywire and cause all this distortion in our health.  Also radiation, can fracture DNA, then it produces fractured/diseased cells that continue to multiply and destroy our tissue.  Take IODINE to offset damage to body from radiation.  Why doc's don't tell us that is another mystery.  You'd think anything that helps w/cure would be forthcoming, surely whole foods, purified water, no sugars, etc. would be standard instruction.  Maybe we can be that crying voice in the wilderness, but if we are heard, we know it will be helpful.   We are all one, we share more than a common enemy, and we can win by sheer determination --- and good diet!   Cheer!
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Riverdivine -I am orig from Boston!   How neat!   I spent all last summer w/family there (Reading & Everett) went to MassGeneral/Dr.Isakoff-Harvard no less...to get all scans and info.   Have to admit, you are lucky to be near MGH, what fantastic people and staff.   I absolutely would never consent to mutilation; errr..mastectomy.  I don't know how women do this, not me.   I just refuse to give my body to someone for dice & slice; I know, we are scared ssss---less when we hear that C word and all we can see is darkness and spooky, but, the thought of slicing my body parts scared me even worse, well think it was the chemo that really scared the P out of me.  You aren't far from help.  Go to: LaserBreastCancerSurgery.com   watch the video, Dr. Ansanelli - NewYork.   He is the most fantastic doctor in the US - no, in the WORLD!   He has been an onco doc/breast surgeon over 50 yrs, has a wife & 4 daughters and decided, no - I wouldn't put my family thru this torturous regimine when there is something just, if not more, effective.  Went to Italy/Israel, learned the technique, returned to do Laser Surgery in NewYork these past  25 years.  I tell you dear, I couldn't believe I was lucky enough to find.   I just could NOT submit my body to the stoneage medicine they had all nicely planned for me....uh, no thank you.  I avoided chemo/radiation, loss of all lymph nodes.   Onco here planned to take ALL - only 4 were positive - what the hay????  Another No thank you.  I was dx'd at Stage4, mets to thyroid, liver, lungs, ribs, pelvis, spine - head, you name it, it was there.    Dr. Ansanelli advised getting the tumor out; cleaning the chest wall would be benefical, plus he only takes the lymph nodes necessary.  Here at onco torture, Inc.  they were going to take the entire breast, ALL lymph nodes, full chemo, full radiation.  That was 2/11...NOW- I have NO tumors in any soft tissue, did have the head lesion removed at MassGen.  it was breast cancer also.  Plus now, no mets to ribs or pelvis, only a spot left in my spine.   Dr. Ansanelli has a much lower recidivism rate of cancer recurrence than traditional surgery. I literally got up and walked off the op table, no cutting, no recuperation time, no PAIN,  I just cannot understand why anyone would chose traditional over Laser.   Very inexpensive, only the laser not covered by insurance, all else is covered---anaesthesia, breast wire localization to pinpoint areas, etc.  I would sell my house, or kids if I had to (joking about the kids). Quick trip to NY, was like a vacation since no pain involved, in/out/done = even went out to dinner that night. Not a single problem since.  Since then,did research, been on disease specific nutrients...DIM/Indole3/Carbinol, Fucoidan (U-Fn), MaitakeMushroom, etc.   if you want the entire list, just buzz me.  My onco here, even tho I can tell he is perturbed that I am improving on my own and he can't take credit, continues to ask "Now, tell me again what is it you are taking" - I am only on Xgeva per mo and daily Aromasin, neither of those are cancer killers, the Aromasin only represses Estrogen production, Xgeva strengthens bone.   I was given 18-24 mo's at best, 8 mos' at worse.  I've overstayed one brilliant doc's forecast,( Ive had 5) know it irritates them.  All bloodwork perfect, vitals, etc. TM's all dropped like lead balloons, the CA25-27 was over 100 and now 60.  CEA & CA15-3 both below the norm levels. We can beat this beast if use our head....Good diet, the right supplements.   Don't ever think you are alone, you aren't.  I've been so ridiculed for going to Laser, doing the nutritional route, who cares, I'm still here.   I have attended 3 friends funeral in last year, 2 breastcancer, 1 pancreatic.  One friend only had Stage 3 and I know it is the chemo that kills, sorry whoever doesn't like hearing it, but when your body is screaming "you are killing me" only way it can, from vomit, sores, hairloss, rashes, black urine, on and on...what do you think?  It may suppress cancer for awhile, but from what i've seen, when it comes back, and it usually does --- ummmmm....I'm fortunate to have good friend in cancer research, you'd regurgitate if you heard some of the stuff she tells me, so don't despair.  I'm no genuis, I just want to continue to breathe as long as I can, enjoy my family and friends.   I know the med way can't guarantee success, nor can I , but i've come to a very good place on nutrition and diet.  My friends only lasted a year or less.   By the way, i'm in this pickle jar because the fabulous medical profession misread my mammogram--got an ALL CLEAR, 14 mo's later i'm Stg4! No idea what happened to 1 -2-3!    Keep in touch, let me know how you are faring and if I can help, just buzz...stay positive and don't let anyone deter what your heart and mind tell you, we were born with a conscience and inbred abilities to know right from wrong, if you don't feel something is helping, keep searching til you get to that "comfy" place.   It's your body, you live in it, and it is special!
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Alady, true you cannot keep the body ph, but you can up the ph level to as high as 8 for a time & it will destroy cancer cells.  The body will return to a normal level of anywhere from 6.5 to 7 which is normal.   Doc's love to say it won't work, but it does work, also doc's say sugar doesn't feed cancer, but cancer lives off glucose -which is sugar,all a play on semantics.  But, they cannot state with fact that cancer cannot live in an alkaliine enviornment -- it cannot, the problem is keeping the body alkaline.  I ck'd and still ck my alkaline with litmus and since I eat mostly fruit/vegs, I stay around 7 to 7.5 and 8, what we eat does matter.  I really don't care what doc's or anyone has to say, I think we know when we actually see the results from what we do, we know we are saving ourselves,something oncologists cannot seem to get right.  When they finally admit chemo kills, then I might give them some credibility.   You might ask your lab friend how enthralled he is with chemo - i'd love to forward you some articles, from TED/Cancer conference/top cancer researchers and the IMVA site, all documented.  I showed a couple to my onco doc and he refused to even read - audacious as they are and also thinskinned, but I think it is due to feeling sheepish because they know they aren't curing anyone, just hoping for a remission.  No one can tell me why or how I got this junk out of my body, but it is gone and the bones are clearing as well...don't let anyone pour cold water on your efforts, we have to keep fighting.  I never knew which protocols to follow so I sort of did everything, but something is working.  I just feel everyone has the right to expect any and all treatments of their choice once dx'd with this beast, after all, we have everything to gain after they tell us it's useless - and I heard those words more than once!  We do deserve every opportunity available, it's our body, our choice and our life! -and, our money too!  Keep well and keep fighting, you have my prayers and best wishes.
Posts.Title: untreated breast cancer for around 8 years. What next?

Posts.Content: Hiheadhen & Hholly..so good to hear from someone else who is refusing traditional hormone/chemo/rads... I was Dxd Jan/2011 at Stg4, opted for laser to remove tumor & any cancer detected, doing nutrients/diet, all soft tissue now free of mets, only in spine and as of Oct went on Cesium Chloride and feel it is helping rid the bone of invasion.  It immediately stopped all backpain, unbelievable. So good to not have that misery following me everywhere.   Next scan due in Feb, so we'll see if it is indeed getting the remaining cancer.   I hope you will continue to improve.   The more i read, the more I realize chemo does very little to rid the core cancer from the body, so why go thru the misery.   The cesium is easy, tastes pretty yukky, but a quick down the hatch & something good to eat takes care of that...I got excellent results from supplements, especially Fucoidan, Maitake/Reishi/ShitakeMushroom, curcumin and of course the LaetrileB-17.   Please share any additional info, we must all stick together to fight this creepy beast.   God Bless and good luck, stay positive.
Posts.Title: I am new to breast cancer I have stage4

Posts.Content: On Jun 28, 2014 1:51 AM carriebelongs wrote: As a former very resourceful social worker, I have looked every where for help.  Now I am making too much money.  If I lower my income just so I can get help, I will have to greatly compromise on my food sources, cut out most of my supplements, and stop seeing my naturopathic doctor.  I'm really okay working but it is frustrating that there isn't more help for someone in need.  Our welfare system gives too much to people who are lazy but capable of working.  It's a "normal" thing I'm doing by working and I am so blessed with this job.  I agree about these cancer research "charities."  I've checked on guide star and saw how much Komen pays their people.  Wow.  It's upsetting.  Here I am struggling and fighting cancer and they are reaping in half a mil for working at a charity.  Pink Ribbon Riders gives money directly to cancer patients and I have received a total of $1,000 from them since diagnosis.  They just don't have enough money to go around. I've heard of the asparagus "cure" and have wanted to do that.  I wouldn't use Green Giant or canned food though.  Can't I just buy asparagus and do the same?  I have a really hard time with the taste of asparagus but it is better than chemo.  I used to like asparagus so I'm not sure why even the site of it is now repulsive.   The Cellect supplement I've been taking the last two weeks have greatly increased my energy.  It's a powder that contains about 150 nutrients in one shake.  It's not the best tasting thing, but it's improving me health.  I see my oncologist in two weeks. you are right - always use "fresh" rather than canned.  Know some areas have hard time finding some vegs, but they are the best bet.  It's a wonder I don't turn yellow with all the carrots I eat, i've heard sometimes it can happen! Just know you aren't alone, do try the Asparagus, goodyou like it, I do too, sure worked like a charm for me.  Let me hear how you do on your next visit to the Naturopathic doc!  Best to you!
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Good for you, know you will continue to have good success, know you have "been thru the ringer" with treatment.  I am also Stg4, DX a year ago, but doc's surmised i've had this cancer at least 2 yrs prior to DX....had the basal cell carcinoma (removed in June), all the spots/splatters, tumors.   As of last June'11 it looked rather grimm, but in Sept'11, most everything gone, only tiny spot left on my spine, reduced 60%, all splatters, spots, tumors gone as well, slight invasion still in the lung mets, but I go for follow up scan next week and hopefully even those will be gone....I refused chemo, went on Femara and Zometa to start, then switched in November to Xgeva and in December dropped the Femara and went on Aromasin as the Femara giving my bones big time aches, plus fatigue out of control and the hotflashes still a worry.  I am big on nutritional and think it is my best defense, Iodine a very necessary must if you have radiation, so please protect yourself, I only get scans, refused radiation as well.  Ck out Fucoidan (U-FN), seaweed extract that loves to eat cancer cells, DIM - Indole3/Carbinol, Curcumin/Tumeric, D3 and several others.   Research and reading have been big help.  Stay on healthy diet, since cancer not bacterial or viral, it is anaerobic and no medicine or treatment alone can prevail, it takes nutritional diet as it is metabolic disease....no sugar, milk products, glutemates, soy, etc.   Keep your body immune system strong and you will survive.   I've never had a single glitch in any bloodwork, always perfect right down the middle.   I know you struggle every day, can only imagine what stamina it takes just to fight, then have to be responsive to needs of precious small children, they will be your guiding light to victory, stay strong and know you have large cheering squad in your corner....best to you, keep us posted.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Congrats to you, so happy your scans are showing improvement.  Can only imagine how that is boosting your morale, you continue and stay positive.  Always great when you have a super duper team to cheer you on,  give encouragement and be concerned for your overall well being.  Know your two little cheerleaders at home are a great boost as well. My prayers for you include a "free of" for them as they grow into lovely young ladies.    WE're both Stg4, i'm ERpos/PRpos,HERneg,  I had laser surgery for tumor removal, partial mastectomy.   Such an easy do....no pain, no cutting, no chance of cancercells/fluids escaping into the body.   Got up and literally walked off operating table, out to dinner that night.  Wish more hospital would stop the body mutilation and institute this procedure.   Laser just as, if not more, successful.   Had clear margins and know it got more of diseased area than cutting.  I've had NO Chemo, NO Radiation.  Got my tumor markers yesterday, CEA Norms are 3.4, mine are 2.1,  CA15-3 norms are 32, mine are 42, CA27-29 norms are 40, mine are now 72!   Last summer went to Mass General, they were on the roof!!!  Scans showed I was in the ditch, lots of invasion in bones and organs.....then in Sept, no organ spots/tumors and only small spot left on spine and few lung mets.    I go for scan on Tuesday, 1/31/12, hoping everything will be gone!  My doc too is amazed, all this in just 7 mo's!  He now thinks maybe I am on to something with the "extra's" I take, plus I daily do the Asparagus puree.   I am firm believer in diet and the supplements.  Especially the DIM/Indole3/Carb and Curcumin/Tumeric, and U-FN Fucoidan.   Please do be sure to take Iodine to keep free radicals at bay if you have any radiation, if fact, even the scans put too much in our bodies and can damage the cells and DNA.  We may have been hit with Stage 4, but WE are going to win this uninvited invasion!   Due to somebody who couldn't read a mammogram, gave me an all clear and if not for a fatty tumor that popped up under my collar bone just above breast, i'd probably be toast!   Had it excised, had cancer cells in it, then the journey began.....You stay strong, know there are days when you want to scream, I do, but go right ahead, you earned the right!   Sending cheer and Godspeed to you!   Stay posted!
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Tam - keep at it, so thankful you've found someone you can work with and get you on a good holistic therapy.  Be sure to investigate good supplements; Fucoidan (U-FN), Photoplankton, Curcumin, Indole, etc....studies show they go after cancer cells in the body, we all need that!   I hate to think how devastated you must have been to have recurrence, but you can beat it.   Chemo is a demon, I can't tell you what to do, I personally have refused and i'm doing great without it.  Just seems when human body is rebelling and telling us how awful we feel, something is very wrong....how can blisters in your mouth, rashes, black urine,  hair falling out, vomiting, fatigue and on and on be a sign that chemo is a cure?   Healthy whole foods, vegs, fruits, nuts, good supplements, and "purified water".   Such a simple thing onco's should encourage....it's about healing the body, not what the pharm co's dictate.   You stay strong and continue with your good program, you've got lots to live for and much to give others.   Keep us posted on your progess.   Sending Cheer and best wishes.....
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: No dear, you are the inspiration....so nice to see such an uplifting msg waiting....Would love to be able to give you a biggie, biggie hug and tell you just how lovely you are.   Want to share a little story my dad told me many years ago, maybe it is true for those of us with this BC & other c's....Tells story of a crowd of people invited to a banquet, but instead of asking the guests to each bring a covered dish, bring your worst problem and lay it on the table, then as you go around the table, you may pick someone else's problem and leave yours.    Surprisingly, at the end of the walk around the table, you will pick your own problem and leave....and you will realize, maybe i'm not so unfortunate after all.   I've thought of that story so many times since my Dx.  It's really hard to imagine we aren't in a "stew", but there's always someone in much worse situation and suffering more than we can imagine.   We know how hard it is for us to get thru the day at times, but if we hold each other in our heart; really care for our fellow sisters & brothers, it does lessen the burden to realize we  aren't alone.   We're all just floundering trying to find a soft spot to give us a bit of comfort, bring joy to our family and enjoy the life God has given us....you are a joy, you are strong, and by all the stars above, you (We) are going to win this battle.   Sending cheer, prayers and joy.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Not illegal to buy Laetrile ( b-17) just hard to find - apricotpower.com has & also d-glucan. Ck them out - I buy apricot pits from them & apricots the best. It's legal the powers that be just try to dissuade they'd rather feed us poisonous chemo! Even bill Clinton does the apricot pits. Good luck
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Well, if anything, know we all agree, carrying this "beast" around and being it's unwelcome host is a hellish burden none  would wish on anyone.  I'm no expert, but like Carrie, we do have to love ourself and be determined.    It is personal for us.   We have to be our own advocates, and, it is not an easy task.  I do put lots of faith in MinaBissel - if you haven't goggled her, do so...MinaBissell/TED Conference.  I agree with her, I've thought some of her thoughts myself.  I especially like her analogy of children in a bad enviornment - they wil more than likely turn out bad, put children in a good, nuturing enviornment, they will more than likely turn out good.  Same for  cells in our body.  A diseased body makes diseased cells, a clean, healthy body, turns out healthy cells - but, the healthy cells are stronger than diseased cells and can take over diseased turf.  Sarah, it's no surprise to me onco's have never heard of benefits of nuturition, they are oblivious to many good therapies.  They only know what they learn in Medical school and most med schools get funding from the conglormerate pharmaceutical companies.  Use my drugs, Do my therapy.  It's a wicked merry -go-round.  We, the victims, are allowed to take a ride, but once on, we are never allowed to get off.   Few months back, while waiting for my appt, sitting next to a man and wife.  I asked how they were doing.  Wife said huband could hardly speak as thrush so severe.  Doc's couldn't get it under control.   Asked - then suggested GentianViolet.  She's not been told of this simple remedy.  She called me the end of the week to tell me her husband's thrust had cleared practically overnight.   NO, i'm no genuis, but this is such an age old standard cure.  Sure most people know of it.  How can any doc not know?  So, my point is, sometimes, the simplest ideas are the best.   Stay well all, stay determined and let God be your respite, HE never fails.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Anyone on Denosumab?   I have been on Zometa, had some ugly sides, more concerned over pain in my left kidney area...anyone similar?   Doc suggested we try the Denosumab next session and see if it lessens ills....Trials say it has better results than the Zometa.    It is injection just under skin, will be new to me, so if anyone on this,please give me an overview...better - worse, SE's, any strange effects....this Breast cancer is the pitts...sending best to all.
Posts.Title: Denosumab

Posts.Content: Know you are upset to hear you have to go back on chemo.  I am surprised with such a low marker,  tho if is rising, they want to clean out any stray cells.   Norms for CEA are 34, norm for CA15-3 is 32 and norm for CA27-29 is 40.   75 really doesn't sound so high,  tho not sure which marker.  My 27/29 is 72, but has been coming down from the hi of 147.  Others are in normal range.   My onco says best indicator of health is how we feel, if we have good energy level, no pain and no interruption in life routine, really the best indicator all is going well.   You have to ask questions and know your best interest at heart,   Please Chrisia, I know without doubt, doing the Asparagus puree daily keeps the body clear of tumors, splatters and spots...know it sounds silly, but i've been doing this daily since last June and markers continue to fall, plus good scans....keeps c-cells from reaching maturity and getting into your body, thus keeps your TM's from rising.  Asparagus, has the molecule found in  Indole or DIM, the cruciferious molecule that attacks cancer cells before they can get into system...it does work. This is ingredient in Tamoxifin before other additives.  Just hope you won't have to be on chemo for long.  Please keep us posted, know you didn't get the news you wanted, but we're all here to cheer you on and want the best for you.  YOu've made such great progress, so wonderful when you hear NO Mets in Body/Bone, just know you will get thru this little bump in road and hopefully soon not only hear NED, but theh big  "R" word.  Sending good wishes and prayer, do let us hear.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Go Grace!   Good news on your TM's, me too-holistic, nutrition and on Aromasin and Xgeva, having excellent results on my TM's &  scans as well.   Think we are all so fortunate to have a good support system to give "ups" on anything we find helpful &  can share.   Hope you are recoving well from the lung collapse and no more of that to worry with.  God does indeed hear our prayers, He is always with us, and together our prayers can keep us strong for one another.    Sending cheer....and prayer.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Tam, broke my heart to hear you didn't get better news, but I was told w/my TM readings, they could very well spike upwards before going down; markers can rise after any new trmt, then fall as med's kick in, so don't be too despondent.   I sit here sometimes & wonder how there can be so many of us in Stage IV.  How on earth did we get from healthy to here.  My case, a misread mamm.  I get an all clear, no problem, 14 mo's later, DX'd w/Stage4!  Then, not even an apology, told  "Well, sometimes that happens"...we all know it's a bit different to hear these words than to speak them.  After that experience, a bit hard to trust medical with my life, already treated so cavalierly w/their mistake that knew I had to be my own advocate, do as much research and learn as much as I could about this enemy that assumes it has the right to take over our body.  Stick with your good diet and supplements, they will keep you strong.   I hate to say this, being on a cancer site, but the more I read about chemo, the worst the results.  Chemo is so destructive to our immune system and you just got another jolt of that stuff, so give yourself time to heal, your body is a tremendous force, it wants to reset itself to healthy, just keep feeding it the good wholesome foods and nutritional supplements, don't underestimate the Asparagus.  Let the med world laugh, I don't see them doing much better with their miserable drugs.   I'm not saying don't do meds, but please,  everyone must do their own research.    It took me about 4 mo's to get the first good scan news, and yes, I was a mess prior.  Mets everywhere, head, thyroid, lungs, liver, ribs, spine (2 spots) l & r pelvis.  Each scan a bit better, it can't be the drugs, i'm only on Xgeva-which strengthens bones,  and Aromasin which deters estrogen production, so I have to credit the supplements & diet. Doc's only doing the basics as they had already told me it was hopeless, just enjoy time I had left.  I know we can win, I have many people praying for me, and I in return pray for all my fellow beings who are touched with this horrid beast, never do I end the day without a prayer for you all.    Stay strong Tam, know how much you wanted to hear positive news.   Know you are loved and thought of, give yourself little time and stay focused, you are too special to be discouraged.    Sending heartfelt love and cheer.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: It's really hard for others to understand, especially when we did as we were told...get your ckups, get your mamm's, then at least in my case, not even "We're so sorry, or any offer to reimburse the cost!"   How can I trust the medical world today, does seem all the good, caring doc's are a thing of the past.  As we all know, 1st question: Insurance???   When did medicine become a business???  We are not machines, we are not a business venture.   My heart goes out to you, you are so young, i've got 20 years on you, let your youth be your strength, continue your supplements, diets and good habits, they get us much further than those spoon fed chemo drugs.   I've watched friends, been with them thru the ordeal, crap....how can anything that does such horrid things to your body be good for you????  Your body is screaming -STOP, you're killing me in the only way it can, all the horrid side effects...The more I read and learn, the less I know, but I do know we are not getting the full story.   I know there are cancers that are virulent and aggressive, but also know that each cancer is different and NO cancer is worsened by a healthy diet and targeted supplements.   If people are being cured with the CesiumChloride treatment, many taking a chance due to not knowing correct mix ratio, I know very well research scientists could get this right and cure the majority of us suffering with this beast, but - it would put thousands out of work, close the doors of hospitals which bring in the Billions.  Are we really just a $ sign?   Very sad to think so, but try getting treatment without $$ or insurance; then let's hear how caring your facility and staff are.   We deserve better.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Keep at it azdesertRat - if I can continue to get these good readings, tumor mrks normal, no cancer in soft tissue, now in secondary remission even tho Stage4, I know we can all be winners.  Itoo go  for bonescan on the 25th....lets share our findings, mine will be in on 3rd July followup, hoping to get good news there, do know that is the most difficult place to clean out....but there's always the CSCI, and I WILL go for it if the mets in my spine are not diminishing. Doc panics when I tell him i'll do this, he sure as #%$& hasn't offered anything.   I know the pain you are going thru, it's misery, I have it, no relief, a constant nagging, Vicodin/Percocet don't really help, makes me rest a little better, but that twisting backbone pain still comes thru.  I've never had chemo or rads, I know it is only temporary so why bother with the poisons that destroy our body.  You know, I had LaserSurgery, cleaned out my chest wall, laser has much lower recidivism rate than traditional mutilation mastectomy.  No pain,no cutting, no chance of fluids filled with cancer cells escaping into the body.....Another BIG anger I vent at onco medicine.   Why do they continue to slice us women like we are a fruit tree in need of pruning.   Laser works, stop mutilating us!  Hearing the C word is devastatingn enough... Then pat on us the head and say, oh honey, don't worry, we're going to make you a brand new breast....forget it dude, i'll keep what I have, wait til it's their wife, their daughter, them....Medicine needs to step out of the dark ages; forget the big $$$ and treat patients like the children of God we all are.    You keep up with your nutrients & good diet, that has been my saving grace...ck out MaitakeMushroomFractionD; Fucoidan, Bitter Melon - Indole3 or Dim, these go after cancer cells, leave the healthy cells.  I know the Fucoidan (or U-FN)dropped my TM's nearly 30 pts in less than a month...nothing else moved them that quickly.   Purified water, whole foods, fruits/veg - organic.  You can get those mets out of your lungs & liver, these supplements will help....Also, heck, do the baking soda/honey - something is destroying my cancer cells and sure you can beat this and have many years added....Keep me posted on your progress.   We have to stay strong and way ahead of this beast.   Blessings to you!
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: HI AzdesertRat....CSCI is Cesium Chloride.   Cesium is a basic salt, also known to kill cancer on contact.  The problem with me, and assume you as well, is we need to zap the cancer in our bone....how do we get the cesium to penetrate the bone and get to the cancer invasion?   It takes the right measurement and weight,  99.9% pure fine grade cesium, rubidium and couple other miracle minerals.   Diet is important as well to keep potassium levels stable.  You have to know what you are doing as it is easy to get heart rhythm out of sync.   I am talking to someone who has done this successfully and I am seriously considering.  Asked my doc about it, he went ballistic, then I asked:  Well, what do you have in your magic  box to save my life---Answer:  Silence, i'm still waiting.   I can only let you know what I know,i've done lots, and I mean lots, of research.  This is about my only hope if I start to go south, and with a Stg4 dx, well....I really feel for you, can't imagine the hell you've been thru and now the back pain - i'm just starting w/the pain and it is a torment.  Have you had the cyber knife or any radiation therapy?  Surely there is something they can offer.  I had my bone scan yesterday, will get results on 3rd & let u know, will be anxious to hear your results as well.  Don't just sit and suffer, be sure they know how painful life is for you.  To be honest, I will probably do the cesium.  know my doc wanted to get the scans & maybe send me for cyber, but if I don't get this C out, which is what I want, I WILL do the cesium treatment.   you need 99.9% pure fine grade cesium as well as the rubidium. I  know where and how to get the right chemicals, but also know this is something I need assistance with from someone in the know...which I have...i'll share any info, so don't fret, but you need to google cesiumchloridecancertreatment.   Please, feel free to buzz in anytime, i'm no expert, but I will not stop making the effort to learn and find a way to beat this beast.  God Bless...
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Hi piperp U-fn. Fucoidan available at vitacost / amazon- / honopure & most online vitamin sites. Add Maitake mushroom, b-17 & glucan - these r available thru apricot power.com . Plus I buy their alkalizer drops to add to beverages-keeps system alkaline. Good luck to u- I am on little vacation so using I/phone to ck msg ? Reply. Hope u recv ol
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Well, if anything, know we all agree, carrying this "beast" around and being it's unwelcome host is a hellish burden none  would wish on anyone.  I'm no expert, but like Carrie, we do have to love ourself and be determined.    It is personal for us.   We have to be our own advocates, and, it is not an easy task.  I do put lots of faith in MinaBissel - if you haven't goggled her, do so...MinaBissell/TED Conference.  I agree with her, I've thought some of her thoughts myself.  I especially like her analogy of children in a bad enviornment - they wil more than likely turn out bad, put children in a good, nuturing enviornment, they will more than likely turn out good.  Same for  cells in our body.  A diseased body makes diseased cells, a clean, healthy body, turns out healthy cells - but, the healthy cells are stronger than diseased cells and can take over diseased turf.  Sarah, it's no surprise to me onco's have never heard of benefits of nuturition, they are oblivious to many good therapies.  They only know what they learn in Medical school and most med schools get funding from the conglormerate pharmaceutical companies.  Use my drugs, Do my therapy.  It's a wicked merry -go-round.  We, the victims, are allowed to take a ride, but once on, we are never allowed to get off.   Few months back, while waiting for my appt, sitting next to a man and wife.  I asked how they were doing.  Wife said huband could hardly speak as thrush so severe.  Doc's couldn't get it under control.   Asked - then suggested GentianViolet.  She's not been told of this simple remedy.  She called me the end of the week to tell me her husband's thrust had cleared practically overnight.   NO, i'm no genuis, but this is such an age old standard cure.  Sure most people know of it.  How can any doc not know?  So, my point is, sometimes, the simplest ideas are the best.   Stay well all, stay determined and let God be your respite, HE never fails.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Hi surviorofbc - Thanks you for your acknowledgement of alernative meds.   Sitting here watchng documentary of Dr. Stanislaw Burzynski (again) and the attack of FDA on his certified cures of cancer back in mid 1990's.   The FDA, Natl Cancer Institutes, Big Pharma all so frightened of their empire falling when the truth is realized.  Alternative medicine is just as good, most people do not get the good results as other w/cancers for the simple reason they have undergone chemo.   I was dx'd Jan'11 - now 17 mo's later, no chemo, no rads.  Diet, vitamins, supplements, reverence for the body and good common sense.  I applaude your life, may you have as many years as you wish.   Sadly, I just fired another doctor last month,  I cannot believe the arrogance of oncologists, or is it all doctors today?   Took an article on the benefits of FractionD-MaitakeMushroom and also Bitter Melon.   He refused to even look at them, slung them across his desk.   So, how can I have faith in anyone so willing to dismiss my interests?   Why the heck should I pay someone to insult me? --Sure they are many people willing to do that for free!   I'd already peeved him as I had LaserBreastSurgery and know that surgery with the ability to clean out my chest wall killed most of the cancer cells.  I am in secondary remission, no tumors in any soft tissue or organs, only spot left is in my spine.   I cleaned out my body with the right supplements and diet, I know it can be done.  My heart breaks for all those patients who put so much faith in traditional medicine, I rely on it as well, but for something that involves life or death, NO, that takes my full attention to do research and study, I cannot turn my life over to some disinterested party that is only concerned about the quality of my insurance.   Yes, traditional meds/doc and sosciety does view us w/Stage4 as being on a way one street leading to a dead end; but, they don't know the secret that we know.    I had friend Dx'd w/identical ER/PRposHRneg BC a week before me, only difference, she was Stage 3B.  She had total mastectomy, chemo, radiation.....I now visit her in the local cemetary.   She died this past February.   I am still here with no ills, aches or problems.    I live with it, but I will be the master of my fate.    Stay strong, we must get the word out.   Again as i've said, I am not telling anyone what they should do, only what I am doing and how I am faring.   I respect anyone for their decision, but do choose wisely.    My best to you and all who have been bitten by this beast, we can win.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Good for you azdesertRat   Don't you fell like dancing and singing in the rain!  Or anywhere!   Just keep a good healthy diet and you should be able to stay met free for long time.  It's been 10 mo's since I recvd good news of  No Mets in any soft tissue or organs, just the spine now to work on!   I still do my daily supplements, Xgeva monthly and Aromasin daily.   Im feeling great, still perfect bloodwork/vitals, TM's perfect, scan 7/3/12 showed only the spine invasion--no further spreading.   We can do it, we have to believe, eat right and fight the beast.  So happy for you!  Can imagine how thrilled you are to recve such good news.  Take bow - well deserved!  Just stay on track!    May God keep you in his hands thru this journey.   Best Wishes and Joy to you!
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Chrisa, YES, we can survive - and a lots long than our doc's may think!  I was told i'd never see my birthday, it's today and i'm feeling great.   Good for you too, 2 1/2 years and many, more to go!   We will all stay strong and fight the beast, it's our body, we didn't invite this unwanted guest, and we can evict it!  I just got off Femara in Dec, switched to Aromasin, not having as many aches or fatigue, noticed my hair getting thicker too, it had begun to fall out and get very thin, so i'm glad that is improving.   Still the hotties tho, but the I-Cool (over the counter) seems to help.   Stay posted and continue to take care of yourself, you can still cleanup those spots and mets, try adding VitB17 (variation of laetrile) and Fucoidan (U-Fn).   They will help bring your tumor markers down and the Fucoidan loves to eat cancer cells, I know it's helping me look good in the scans.  I swtiched from Zometa to Xgeva....you might want to inquire, so much easier to get a quickie shot, doesn't hurt and i've had no side effects.   Stay strong, sending cheer!
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Well, i'm getting close to year 6, but I always give most of the credit to being alive to having laser surgery rather than traditional surgery for mastectomy.  Has a much higher cure rate and even higher rate of a no recurrence.  I have been on Aaromasin for 5plus years.  I did get all the tumors out of my soft tissue, then used csci(cesiumchloride) in an effort to rid my metassis in the bone....some success, but not completely.  Last visit I had the faslodex shots - 2 shots, and NO, they do not hurt, little more than a flu shot, but nurse kept saying people cry, scream, etc.  I was expecting the shots from hell, but they are not that painful.  The invasion in my spine is near to my spinal cord, my onco now wants to bombard me with radiation, but I've ck'd into PROTON POSITON theraphy and plan to go to one of the centers next week.  It is a direct beam which only affects the cancer, doesn't spray radiation all over you.  I know radiation is very harmful, can cause all sorts of problems, may not appear immediately, but will in time...tho many do suffer burns at time of radiation, plus hair loss and possibly heart damage, as radiation can cause muscle tissue to harden.  For supplements that do help:  IP6 -Inositol, Tumeric/Curcumin, B17/Amigdalin, Beta Glucan, U-fn/Fucodian, Reishi/Matiake/Shitake Mushroom, Calcium w/D3, Magnesium-time released is best -Magnesium is a wonder nutrient.  Sure there are a few others, but mostly, keep your diet ph negative.  Remember - cancer cannot live or thrive in a ph neg enviornment...Add peroxide drops to beverages, will help keep your ph low....Eat natural foods, no SUGAR, milk or soy - soy is detramental after cancer strikes, causes more problems than good it does.  I've learned so much since being hit with this bomb, but mostly i've learned onco's don't know as much as they should, if not for Protocol, they'd be lost as a snowfake - that's their little slide card, if you have this, then match the color to the disease and do this, this, and this....then, hope for the best!  I've also learned that when onco's were polled at an oncology convention nearly 90% said if they or family got cancer, they would not do chemo, yet they wantn to spoon feed it everyone else.  You have to stay informed, then you can make really good decisions.  It's YOUR body, you live in it, it's the only one we get, so don't be bullied.  Learn all you can, stay diligent and determined.  Google-Mina Bissell/TED, she knows what cancer is - she is a top cancer researcher.  Also google  Ben Goldacre - too funny, but he too "gets it".  Good luck.  Let me know how you do!
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Debra, you are too kind.  I am in the stew the same as you and others, but together we can create a spirit of positive outlook.   You, and all of us, are very important to this earth, we were put here to enjoy life, we may have this unfriendly invasion in our body, but I know doing our research we can find a way to continue to breath in life.   I too had hip replacement, both....right in '99 and left in 2010, see you had a fall, hope you are faring well and no problems.   I have 4 grandchildren, they are such a joy, the oldest graduates H/school this year and starts college in fall, great student in honors programs, all are very sweet and make life a continuing joy to see how one generation creates the link to the next generation...Ties that binds us thru the ages.   Stay positive and strong dear, do not let anyone or anything push you off your path, just remember, you aren't traveling alone.   Blessings to you.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Carrie, i've got a great support (tiny) group for support..We try to keep each other focused and from i'm reading, you need someone to stick with you til you get back on track.  You can beat this beast back into it's nasty den, but you have to be determined.  What are your tumor marker readings?  What did your last scans show?  Don't despair dear, i've been through 7 oncologists.  You are paying, if they cannot answer your questions, (Two of mine could not tell me what cancer is- I had to tell them).  This one cell that goes haywire and grows and grows is a crock, if that were the case, we'd be one big blob of cancer.  For sure, you don't, nor do any of us, deserve the bullying that seems to be part of cancer treatment, i've talked to many and they too have been bullied, happened to me  - once, can guarantee you that doc, nor any others will do it again.  I never goad or speak down to anyone, and I will not allow anyone to assume I am at their service for such treatment.  I am a child of God, as are you, as are onco's, they need to remember that when addressing us and bringing treatment to the discussion table.  Discuss - do not berate if we ask questions, have doubts, or say NO.  Juicing is good, not all nutrients are necessary, only the ones that boost your immune system, Yes, I have done Honokiol, all the things I take have a good study rating for effectiveness.  But---best of all is what we eat.  Fresh vegs, fruits.  Check out a agood ph diet and always tell yourself, someone loves me and wants me to be here for them.  You count, there is only one of you, God would not have made you if you had no purpose.  Doc's love to tell us we are going to die if we don't do as told - heck, if they were right, I'd already had my funeral. Told me I would not liveto see the end of 2011.....well, i'm still breathing, I know i'm alive because I still pay taxes!    Give yourself some time, hate that you are still working, rest is a priority need with cancer.  Have you ck'd to see if you can get an easier schedule,maybe a 4-day week - or even disability?   Get all the info from you doc on your overall health, make them give you the reports from every bloodtest, scan and any procedures, you have a right to them and need to know if you are holding or fading.  Best to you, let me know how youo made out with your doc on this last appt!   I'm still doing pretty good, i've never had chemo or radiation, but willing to do the Proton, which is direct beam.  Stay well, sending inspiration and cheer.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Ak6624 - Yes dear, do stay positive and never give up. Know there are times you can be so overwhelmed and have doubts the journey worth continuing---but, none of us invivted this beast into our body and we can make it just as uncomfortable for "IT" as it is making us..Good you are on whole foods, also intake only purified water.  Add Fucoidan and Phytoplankton to your supplements as well as Iodine to offset effects of radiation.  Curcumin and Indole3 will supress cancer cells in your body, the Fucoidan/Phytoplanktons show signs of actually destroying cancer cells.  Know you've been thru the pitts with the surgeries and recoup, it's not an easy journey, but you do have all here on this site to offer support and prayers, you are not alone, I never end my day without prayer for all my fellow brothers and sisters in Christ suffering from this disgusting vermin, let us hear from you, posting is good, keeps your spirits up and others do care...sending a biggie hug and cheer.    PS.,Tho I only lost little hair on Femara, I know how traumatic that is for us women, doc's sometimes don't realize how personal our hair is to us, nor do I suspect when they tell us "that breast has to go", but hey,  time to visit the wig store and be that wild redhead or bouncy blonde, don't worry, you are still you and love doesn't "see" our worrisome changes...Blessings to you.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Hi All...know we all want to share any positive news.   I've come across fascinating article regarding HONOKIOL,   so did a search - Wikipedia and other sites, seems like more good news for us, bad news for cancer cells.   I've ordered for myself, haven't recvd, but know you will all want to read up and see what you think.   As we know, lots of good results come to us from Asia, they have done lots of research and have been blessed to have many of these amazing supplements.  Would be interested to see what any of you think as well.  KNow we all just our bodies free of this ravage and a return to wellness....my wishes for you all.  Blessings....
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: I have heard of citrus pectin, I haven't taken it, so far, i'm doing pretty good.  I do take Honokiol, Grapeseed extract and tumeric/curcumin which I think is probably the most helpful of all supplements.  Know it's hard to stay on a good diet, I think i'm pretty disciplined, but I slide out of bounds frequently.  I eat right, but have that naughty habit of adding X foods - ice cream, occasional Mascapone desserts which are my weakness, but i'm fortunate to have a good GP whom I can call a friend as well, she keeps tabs on my tumor markers and they aren't going up, so don't think i'm too far off.  You might want to boost your immune system before your next bloodwork.  What always works for me is the so-called Asparagus cure.  My TM's were in the 80's, now normal,  Being cruciferous, asparagus does have something that gets cancer out of the blood....Just boil can of GreenGiant Asparagus, cool, puree in blender, take 2 -3 Tblspoons pm and am.  I have no idea how or why this works, but I can certainly attest that it works for me, also two cancer friends will say the same.  One w/BC, the other with leukemia.  Very inexpensive, works better than supplements, or, if you like, eat steamed asparagus as often as you can.  It is a wonder food.  This was all I did back few years ago when I had cancer everywhere.  In 90 days, the next scan showed zilch in my body.  You must be determined, do it every day.  I thought, this is ridiculous, I should be laughing at myself, but I stayed with it and the payoff was well worth it...I do love asparagus though, even if you don't, it isn't bad....beats chemo any day of the week!  I can't believe the AM/CancerSoc  doesn'thave some sort of help available for you.  Do you work a full 5 day week?  As well as i'm doing, that would zonk me into the next century.  People who don't have this scourge have no idea how debilitating it can be.  It's not just the odd, hard to explain pains that pop up in different areas, fatigue, loss of appetitie, uncontrollable appetitie at times, just so many strange occurences in our body....all crammed together it makes for a miserable existence at times, people think "oh, that can't be", we well know it can.  I have found a near miracle for my fatigue---SuperDailyEnzymes and Mn-Zyme.  I Both just dietary supplements, th MnZyme a bit pricey, maybe 35$ for 100 tabls, but I had cut my walks from 3 miles to maybe a half, plus have always been strong swimmer, no problem to go one end of lake to other, but noticed last year it was impossible.  This year, manage more distance every try and feel in couple more weeks my stamina will be back to my old routine.  They may help you get through the day at work without being so worn out and frazzled.  I really get angry when I hear so many fighting this beast are then smacked with a "no help available" sign.  So much baloney out there about helpful orginizationns, but when it is YOU that needs help, seems it evaporates.  I refuse to give a penny anymore to cancer funds for that reason.  All they are doing is Empire Building, trying to be the biggest and most well known of the Pink Ribbons.  The funds they raise should go to those in need--NOT RESEARCH.  Our tax money is going for the research, the government funds cancer research, gives millions of our tax dollars, yet we are bombarded for $5, $10 or more making us think they are desperate.  We are the desperate ones, needing meds, transport, etc.  So, don't be taken in on that one.  I've learned.  Just hope you will have good news soon.  Keep posting.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Many people, as myself, have had favorable results with alternative treatments.  I watched two best friends fade w/medical oncology and die a horrorific death, that is why I refused traditional breast cancer tmt.  I opted for Laser Surgery to remove tumor.  No pain, no mutilation no need for hellish reconstruction.  I also refused chemo, radiaition.  I was dx'd at Stg 4, so why bother with more detramental treatment.  I am in what they call secondary remission, I still have invasion in my spine, but otherwise all cancer is gone.  I have done CSCI, and will do it again, it will cure cancer in bone.  I rid my body of 8-9mmtumors, so I must disagree with your statement that people never hear from those who choose alternate methods.  I've been posting on here since 2010, i'm still here, I am in good health, still much energy and no cancer other than met to spine. I did Kelmun, Asparagus, CSCI, nutrition and supplements. I'm here, My TM's are in range, all bloodwork/stats are perfect. So, yes, people who have had good results do post. I'm one of them. I will NEVER do chemo, it is thoroughly destructive to the body, maybe that is why when oncologists were polled if they would take chemo, 78%  said no, yet they love to spoon feed it to everyone else.  Everone has a choice, I exercised mine, all should be free to do the same, but yes, alternative therapies can and do work.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: How high are your tumor markers?   Lots of things can make them go up?  Which TM is going up...CEA, CA27-29 or CA-15...Are you bone scans clear as well??   Did he say how long period he wants to put you on for the Gemzar?
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Dintle---I've been on Ufn nearly two years.  I was Dx'd Jan/2011 at Stg 4 (due to misread  mamm).  I opted for LaserSurgery (LASERBREASTCANCERSURGERY.COM) to get the tumors out, had them in lungs, liver, basal cell on scalp, ribs, ---you name it, it was there.  Was told I'd never make it past Nov/2011 as so widespread.  Well, here it is June, 2013, all tumors in soft tissue gone, nothing in the body except the spot in the spine, but it has not appreciated in over 2 years, after a small reduction.   I know the LaserSurgery put me on a much better road than standard mastectomy.  I've had NO chemo or radiation, I've opted for naturo path and I have outlived 2 friends, one dx's same time as me, another nearly a year later, so I feel I made the better choice.  First, go to Kelmun Protocol and silly and simple as it sounds, I know this got most of the cancer mets, then stay on the Ufn, which is highly potent cancer killer.  Fucoidan (Ufn) is an extract from brown seaweed.  Even Sloan Kettering Cancer Center using as they have seen the good results in patients.  Also, not sure what your particular type cancer is, but for DCIS as I have, I've found the following very effective as well.  DIM (Indole3/Carbinol) Curcumin/Tumeric, Maitake/Reishi/Shitake Mushroom capsules (these are amazing, hospitals now waking up to the power of mushroom to fight and eat cancer) Iodine,Selenium, B17/Laetrile, Beta Glucan, try to find Apricot Pittseed, eat 3 -4 daily, these contain a veg cyanide and will kill cancer cells, unharm healthy cells, just lots you can do to keep yourself ahead of the beast.  I have and i'm doing fantastic.  All bloodwork perfect, stats, scans.  Have good energy level, even my onco is amazed, said old age will get me before the "beast".  So, just know there is lots you can do.  Get on a good alkaline diet, cancer cannot live in an alkaline enviornment.   Remember when people used to say,Oh, if they cut you open, the cancer will spread, the oxygen will feed it - WRONG!   Oxygen kills cancer.  All the diets you see touting HydrogenPeroxide; baking soda, etc. are right, they create apoptsis in the body.  Doc's will say, well it can't kill all the cancer----well, neither can chemo, but chemo will kill the good cells as well and the natural substances will not kill healthy cells and give the immune system the punch it needs to destroy cancer.  I've done the research, I don't do just anything, I see the progress i've made, and as mentioned, I wouldn't be in this cancer boad had the medical genuises done a better job of reading my mammogram.   But, then I think, had they found it sooner, I may have been exposed to the debilitating misery of mastectomy mutilation, chemo/rad/reconstruction.  I bypassed the misery.  Laser is MUCH more effective, gets all the visible cancer, plus whereas the onco's had said they would take ALL my lymph nodes, I only had 4 positive, they took 5 and the 5th was clear, so I don't have the worry of lymphodema, nor did I have to experience the misery of recuperation.  I literally got up and walked off the op table from laser surgery, went to dinner that night, and now, 3 years later I am in perfect health.   Love yourself, you can win this battle.   Godspeed.
Posts.Title: U-fn Natural Dietary Suppliment

Posts.Content: Know you are out of your mind with millions of questions and worry.  Just take deep breathe and know you've got great support team here on CC site.  I was Dx last Jan (on my birthday!)....Onco wanted to take the entire breast, all lymph nodes, chemo, radiate then whoopie, we'll just slice part of your tummy and make you a new boob.   I opted for Laser Surgery.  EASY!!  No pain, no cutting, no chance of cancer cells escaping.  Go to Laser Breast Cancer Surgery.com .  Talk w/Dr. Ansanelli, tell him Elaine in GA recommended.  He will discuss at length (without charge) all options.  Believe me, it is well worth it.  He is a Breast Surgeon of great renown, been Doctor of the Year twice in New York State and now state considering instituting teaching this procedure in hospitals...ABOUT TIME!    I got 2in clear margins and great results.   Now medical centers are starting to realize dark age mutilation of women not the best way to excise breast disease.  I had partial mastectomy, still have 90% of my own breast, still wear same size bra!  Don't sell yourself short, doc's will yank you around like a rag doll, they have tunnel vision and can't see anything except what medical books teach. Heck, i'm on my 6th oncologist, fired the first 5 for their "superior" attitude and dismissiveness.    I feel I am so much further ahead, I do have cancer, but this surgery was sure easier than going to cold, hospital setting and facing the misery of debilitating surgery and losing lymph nodes...pain to the 10th power!   If you want to discuss w/me,  just post and I'll send you private reply and phone, just hang on tight, all will be ok.   I'm sitting here w/Stg 4, but last scan showed all tumors, splatters/spots gone except for one tiny spot left on my spine.....and, I was a hugh mess when had the first scans in June, so just know you will be ok, it's a journey none of us choose, it chooses us, but we can make it.  I've never had chemo - will not, just as stats show, chemo does nothing for breast cancer, a total waste, plus 85% of polled doc's said they would not have chemo,yet they cavalierly prescribe for everyone else.  It may add couple years, give remission, but then it returns w/a vengance and you have no defense and you probably would have been able to have same results with less traumatic drugs.   I am on Femara pill daily and monthly  Xgeva shot  both  a "sort of" chemo, but without the posions.    Do your research.  I'm also doing the Asparagus daily and BiCarb w/Honey.   They are natural and don't interact.  Also ck out Curcumin w/Tumeric, Indole3/Carbinol and take your calcium and Iodine will help as well.    Just don't let anyone talk you into anything you aren't comfortable with, if they can't answer ALL questions and treat you like a living wonderful creation of God, RUN!
Posts.Title: Diagnosed an hour ago -- IDC

Posts.Content: On Sep 05, 2014 4:07 PM heidik wrote: Hi there, I am desperately seeking out info about laser surgery for my friend with small cancerous breast tumor.  Would love to speak with someone who has been operated on by Dr. Ansanelli.  Can anyone help?  Thank you so much in advance! -heidik ME!  I visited Dr. Ansanelli for Laser Breast Surgery  after being diagnosed w/ Stage 4 BreastCancer due to misread mammogram.  I have NO doubt that Dr. A saved my life with the laser.  All my tumor markers are now normal, all bloodwork/stats perfect.  My onco here just has no idea what to say.  I am still Stg 4, but have no problems, health is good.  I refused chemo, that too saved my life.  I was dx'd same week as friend, she did the surgical mastectomy, chemo, radiation, reconstruction, etc.  She went through awful time.  They removed ALL her lymph nodes, I only had 4 removed, the 5th was clear, so no need, yet my onco had planned to take ALL lymph nodes....Removal of lymph nodes can cause all sorts of misery and pain.  For me, I think Dr. Ansanelli hung the moon.  He is fantastic, has twice been named Doc of the "Year in New York, well deserved.  I've made friends w/couple of other women who have been there, we all feel he is a life saver and appreciates that women should not be "mutilated",  His surgery is so simple, painless, easy.  I got up after surgery, went to dinner that evening.  My daughter accompanied me, you can bet, should she ever be afflicted with this beast, I will immediately have her there to be cared for.  Dr. Ansanelli is what all onco's should be, sadly, they are very lacking in the needed skills - considerate and sincerely concerned for the care of the patient.  WHen I first recvd my diagnosis, like all, I was nearly hysterical.  I was online day and night until I found alternative to the mutilation that lay ahead, at 2am in the morning my husband was begging me to please come to bed, but I was so distraught I couldn't even think, then I noticed  blue light on my computer was blinking, I knew I had turned it off, so got up to turn it off again, when I did, up on the screen pops "Laser Breast Cancer Surgery.  I could not wait for daylight, then I called his office at 8am, then  8:30, close to 9am, Linda, his receptionist at time was answered.  I could not speak intelligently, I was blabbering on,  I will always remember her telling me," Everything is going to be fine , no  need to be concerned any longer, I'll have Dr. A call you as soon as he walks in,  he understands the anguish,  anxiety and concerns, he has daughters.  She went on to tell me she had had the laser surgery for her BC.  Shortly thereafter, Dr. A called me.  He is the most calming soul I have ever talked with in my entire life.   I was immediately at ease and a peace like i've never experienced came over me.  He called me three or four times to answer all my questions.  Don't know about you, but no doctor I know will even give the time of day without first getting payment before talking! Within a few days I was in his office with my daughter, she was now my care-giver and did quite an excellent job of mothering me.  No wonder I have such wonderful grandchildren!  I had the surgery, woke up, no pain.  My daughter and I went to dinner that evening, enjoyed some NewYork shopping, then flew home in 2 or three days.  My only problem was some leakage from having the lymph nodes removed, that area will be the only discomfort, but he will give you pain meds, I think I took two!  What can I say?  Don't doubt you have made the right decision, He is fantastic.  I credit his treatment/surgery with saving my life.  No chance of fluids escaping into the body to set up new cancerous areas.  I had been told here locally, unless I did the surgery,  the chemo, rads, etc. I would not live to the end of the year.  Really?  I'm here, in very good condition, all TM's in normal range, bloodwork, stats all perfect.  I am doing alternative, I watched my friend who was diagnosed same week as me.  She had the surgical mastectomy, chemo, radiation, reconstruction, she went through torment.  She also had a funeral.  I am angry, why are we not told there is an easy remedy, one that is not disfiguring, painless, easy, better cure rate and better non-recurrence?   I've learned---it's the money.  Breast Cancer can bring in over a million dollars from diagnosis to end day treatment, of which there really is no end.  That's why I do believe that cancer is the gift that keeps on giving - to the medical industry.  I am angry for every woman who has had to endure the misery and anxiety and pain, difigurement, every misery that is attached to this beast.  It is just not necessary.  I am not special, I am no genius, but i'll be dogged if i'll turn myself over to medical staff without doing my own research first.   Every improvement in my fight is due to my own research,  i've always said if this beast wants me it is going to have to  fight lots harder before it takes me down, and damn, if it does, at least my friends and family will recognize who it is in the casket.  I cannot say the same for my two friends  lost to this beast.  Cancer is never satisfied with the destruction it creates, we then  lost our son, only 41, to this beast.  He  died from lung cancer - a non smoker, a joy to all who knew him.  So since my Dx,  my worry is for my husband, we've been married now little over40 years, this beast killed his first wife at her young age of 36 (BC) leaving him with two small boys, one of which that hellish beast took from us at his young age of 41.  Cancer destroys life, the person stricken, the family and the friends and also leaves an unfinished life that could have brought so much joy to others.   You call Dr. Ansanelli tomorrow - I guarantee it will be the best gift you can give your wife and yourself....My best wishes to you, God bless and keep you both safe and well.
Posts.Title: Calling all alternative cancer treatments experiences...

Posts.Content: Hi Diana-just want to add -can't imagine why doc's want to remove breasts pronto. Well, $$$ - if you ever need "EXPERT" care re: breastcancer,  go to LaserBreastCancerSurgery.com , Dr.Ansane lli.  He can get ALL the cancer without mutiliation surgery.  I finally got to get in the face of the onco that originally told me, Oh, you'd rather have VOODOO surgery than tried and true cure???  Well, who is laughing now Mr. Onco doc?  Anyway, every onco I visited told me there is no cure for cancer, only diligent constant treatment....so, onco's make up your mind. You wouldn't believe the hostility I encountered because I chose my own path and now no cancer can be found.  Who cares, I win.  You too.  Stay strong, don't be a lemming, no one cares for us and our family as we do, no one is going to care if the end result is positive, the final statement is always the same:  Well, we did the best we could, we followed protocol but so sorry it didn't work, nothing else we could do.   At least we know that is a crock!   Protect your daughters, I have one too, she was with me from day 1, went to NY w/me to Laser Clinic and she knows her mom is going to make sure if this beast ever attacks her,  mom is going to make sure she gets proven care & cure.  I'm 70, so at least we've been around the block a time or two and know baloney not only by sight, but by it's smell as well!
Posts.Title: I said no to rad&chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Tenacity, you are always welcome to share, no matter what particular cancer. Jesicahshope & Diana have very good insight, I am putting my 2 cents worth in -  I've never had chemo or rads; told i'd never last by Nov 2011, here it is going into 2014 and feeling great, doc's now ask what i'm doing.  I find oncology leaves much lacking, all doc's trained to do the standard 1 -2 3, seems they cannot think for themselves, all of us are different, even w/same cancer we will react differently to treatment, yet seems onco's will stick to the prescribed theraphy no matter if the patient is deteriorating or making progress.   Remember too that radiation can cause very serious heart problems in women, causes lots of thickening and hardening around the heart, not to mention the adverse radiation and common burns.  For me, staying PH balanced with diet after the Laser had proved very beneficial. We all have our immune system to keep us battle ready, keep it in good working order and it will do as nature intended.  Wishing you & ur mom all the best.
Posts.Title: I said no to rad&chemo

Posts.Content: True, R&D is expensive, but - it is all going to end up in the cost vs. efficacy bottom line.  If Pharmaceutical Co's cannot make a big profit, many life saving drugs will never reach the individuals so in need.  I'll never forget reading the book -  "Genocide" - The Cancer Coverup.  Pharmacy co's went after people who had found good, inexpensive remedies that slowed and stopped cancer growth, threatening people into backing away.  The statement that burns into my brain from a top FDA official:  Well, yes, we know it works, but we don't know how, so we will not approve it.  WHO CARES how it works, if it works and you have late stage cancer, what #$&# difference does it make!  Money is the key, everything today is a business, medicine, education, anything that can make a
