penney.  I used to think there is no way you can put a price on human life - well, seems there are people who have no problem doing just that.  I try to stay current w/therapies - now, a new long study has shown that ONE - yes, ONE radiation treatment is as effective as the multiple radiation treatments.  Yet, it will take a long time for that to be accepted, too much profit in the treatment, someone has to pay for the equipment.  All i'm saying is the patient is always preveiwed prior to treatment, how good is the insurance and is it cost effective?  Radiation is a very powerul and very DANGEROUS undertaking, the younger, the more dangerous, it affects the body in yet untold ways, the told ways are enough to frighten.  As with our friend who underwent radiation for prostate cancer 10 years ago, now has no control over bladder problems, they didn't appear immediately, came on gradually.  Radiation doesn't stop with the last treatment, it continues to thrive and destroy, yes can zap some of the cancer, but other vital organs as well.  I've never had rads or chemo, I opted for Laser - no side effects, completely destroyed the tumor without invasive surgery, the #1 reason I am still thriving, yet my onco & radiologist both said I was wasting my time and money on a VOODOO treatment!   I'll take the Voodoo any day, call it what you will, i'm still here and "THEY" are the ones with egg on their face.   I'd never tell anyone not to do as they wish, but for me, I have to "see" the research, talk to people, investigate for myself, what i've found is sickening.  We aren't getting the best care, no matter what hospital, they all following the slide card remedy, match the color codes, do the treatment. We deserve better, sadly, it's up to US to find the best and most effective treatments.  As for Pancreatic cancer, there are many new treatments, I sat with my best friend from dx day to the end, it was hideous watching her waste away, and without doubt, the chemo is what killed her.  Radiation can shrink tumors, make them disappear, but many times they return.  I've never read a 30% cure for pancreatic cancer, if indeed you have found 3 of 10 patients survive, you should forward the results to the NCI.  They still give around 6%.  Yes, I am angry, no one should have to endure the misery she encountered.  And for sure, when buried, you should be able to identify the body in the casket.  Unforgivable is the only word that fits, none of her treatment did anything to prolong her life, yet they never stopped even when she couldn't stand on her own two feet.  We all deserve better.   As for it working,  for 3 of 10 w/pancreatic cancer, the best NCI stats still put it at 6%; a far cry from 30% stated.  That would be a pretty good stat, but so far is still a dream.  that is 6 of 100, not 30 of 100 as you state w/3 of 10.   I had mets, 8mm, in lungs,liver, thryroid, everywhere, I was dx'd at Stage 4, due to a misread mammogram...thank you, medical industry.  A simple baking soda and maple syrup (The Kelmun Protocol) which may indeed help your mother, eradicated all, yes ALL tumors in my soft tissue within 90 days.  My onco nearly fell off his stool...Me, I smiled.  Sometimes the simple remedy is the best.  Yes, I still had invasion in my spine, ribs, pelvis, the CSCI eradicated 60%, none in my pelvis, ribs, I will undergo another round of CSCI in 6 months and I have every confidence I will be done with the beast.  Good riddance. and the best part -no radiation, no chemo.  Call me a wimp, but I love my body, it was entrusted to me by my creator, God Almighty.  HE put a brain in my head, gave me obstacles to overcome and I will do all within my power to survive and return to him one day in a old, decripit body, but one free of cancer.   It is my wish for all who encounter this miserable beast.   God bless each on your journey.
Posts.Title: I said no to rad&chemo

Posts.Content: I applaude your efforts, I would certainly chose theh same path if I were in your shoes.  I, a BC patient, chose Laser.  Much similiar, eradicated tumor, zapped as much cancer as appeared, no cutting, bloodloss, no chance of cancer cells escaping to set up housekeeping in other areas of the body, no body mutiliation, and best of all, no pain.  I am so distressed that our medical industry is soo slow to engage in these newer, less invasive and in the majority of cases, much more benefical in eradicating the beast.  I know my laser experience,even at Stage 4, has cleaned by body of the beast and set me on the right course.  I hope and pray that you continue to see the best of your hopes materialize.  It's an unpaved path, but thanks to people as yourself & your mom, you are the pavers for those that must travel that same path.  I just wish more people would be as brave and stop accepting "protocol" without challenge, it is not the saving grace all rely on.  Best to you.
Posts.Title: I said no to rad&chemo

Posts.Content: Good for you!!!  Sadly,very few will do their own investigations in to alternative methods.  I was dx'd at stage 4 - thanks to a misread mammogram.  I should have been dead long ago, I did my own research, had laser surger to get the tumor out, it is necessary to always get the tumor out to stop the cancer cells from spewing into the body.  Not traditional surgery, LASER!  No pain, no cutting, no chance of cancer cells escaping into the body.  Guess we know, no one really wants a cure for cancer, it is the BIG money industry.  Stats show chemo/rad is little effective in treating cancer as opposed to ph therapy.  But, no cost there.  I had been given dire news, now, cancer free due to diet/ph/ and cesiumchloride. Lets hope more people will be willing to use their head rather than their ears to fight this scourge.  I'll never forget the one line I read that convinced me above all else: Doctors polled asked if they would take chemo if they were dx'd with cancer - 87% said NO.   Enough reason for me.  Good luck.  Simple remedies are the best, and....they work!
Posts.Title: I said no to rad&chemo

Posts.Content: hi bijgirl...hate when I hear these hormone treatments cause pain, know it can wreak havoc on planning days just for the simplest of chores and outings.   I've been the Femara route, now on Aromasin just since November.   So far, no s/e's, but I know once it infiltrates the body it can create havoc.  I'm  hoping it will be a long delay, better if never,  before any s/e's....Was heartened when scans came back clear, with only the one tiny spot on spine, so guess it's worth the fatigue/pain & hot flashes to see such good improvement.   Try to concentrate on the good the pain is doing.   I've found some  supplements help w/fatigue, try Zinc, Magnesium and B12.   Mostly, be good to yourself, long hot soaks in tub and don't think you have to do so much, you've earned some downtime, rest every opportunity.    Don't think 5 yrs...just think today, tomorrow will take care of itself.   Sending Cheer and wishes for better days without fatigue and pain.
Posts.Title: Any good reports on taking Aromasin?

Posts.Content: In defense of Diana, don't think she means to be offensive....When you see beyond doubt that the only reason you are treated for cancer is the profit, it's a bit hard no to be judgemental.  I encounted a couple in the hallway of my onco's office, they had been turned away as they didn't have good insurance coverage...if doctors were really concerned with the welfare of patients,surely they could have directed this couple to the proper agencies to apply for care.  Doc's have all sorts of agency listings for indigent cancer victims.  I've watched two friends go through the routine--surgery,chemo,radiation, after care, both died a hideous death.  When the deterioration begins, doc's want to wash their hands of the patient, turn them over to hospice or heavy drugs.  There is always hope, but, with PROTOCOL, they can only do what is approved care, even though there are many remedies that can prolong life.  I know, I'm one who was told, Go home, get your affairs in order, you'll be gone by end of year, 2011.  Now - no cancer in body, my onco is shocked, yet he refused to do anything.  I had to do my own research.  At Stage 4, it is dire, but the CSCI treatment worked for me, it can work for others. There are many treatments than can prolong life and zap cancer into remnission.   So, yes, I think many of us are a bit frustrated, maybe we do scream and shout, but when you have a death sentence over your head, or a loved one, seems to me it is quite an appropriate  and natural response.  As i've always said, Actions speak louder than words.  All the comforting words in the world don't cure cancer, you have to take action, research and DO whatever is necessary to prolong your life, no one else is going to care for you or a loved one as much as you or family, and many helpful remedies offered on site offer more of a chance at life than the standard "Protocol."
Posts.Title: I said no to rad&chemo

Posts.Content: Laser treatment for me due to DCIS/BreastCancer, Stage4-three years ago.  So strange, some onco's will not do anything once Stage 4, see no point - WRONG!  Get the tumor out, it's like a mother ship spewing cancer into the body.  Go to MinaBissel (Utube TED TALKS)- she is a top cancer researcher, explains how once you clean the body of most cancer cells, the good cells will overtake the diseased.  I went to NewYork for Laser, Dr. Vincent Ansanelli, a top NewYork BreastSurgeon, over 25 years practicing,  been at all the top hospitals in NewYork, twice named Doctor of the Year in N.Y.    GO TO: LaserBreastCancerSurgery.com     I called him after many hours of searching for alternative when local onco doc said he would do traditional mastectomy, remove all lymphnodes, do chemo/rad and reconstruction....NO thanks, I'm not one for body mutilation & destruction.  There are several on thia site who have visited him, we are all thriving.  You can get those mets out of soft tissue very easily, I did.  Many have.  HAve several friends, one w/leukemia has done this and dropped his count from 600,000 to below 100,000.  Can't tell me it doesn't work.  Very simple, causes apoptosis, which causes oxidation in the body and, for lack of better description, causes cancer cells to burst and disappear.  I have NO cancer in any soft tissue. So easy to do - go to:  KelmunProtocol.com .  Beware, will cost you abount 3 cents a day!   Go for it, simple, proven and easy!  God Bless!
Posts.Title: I said no to rad&chemo

Posts.Content: Dx 2010/BC already Stg4 -due to misread mammogram. I have NEVER had chemo, no radiaition.  I opted for Laser Surgery, kept my breast, removed the tumor.  No pain, no long recuperation, no need for reconstruction and all the misery. Got off op table, went to dinner that evening, returned home in two days.  My tumor was 9cm, had soft tissue tumors everywhere, lungs, liver, Did the Asparagus cure, laughed at myself, but in 90 days, they were gone, but I think the Laser rid most of the invasion.  Google MinaBissel/TEDconference, explains how the body works to rid cancer cells, I try to stay on a ph neg diet, cancer cannot live in an oxygenated enviornment, cells cannot reproduce.  My tumor markers are now normal, I am no fan of chemo, the bodyis already compromised, chemo only rapidly diminishes healthy cells.  Get your immune system in top order, yes, Reishi/Mitake/Shitake do help, also Fucoidan or Ufn, Curcumin, Inositol 6, Indole 3/Carbinol, Beta Glucan.  Do your homework, you can beat the beast, i'm nearing end of 5 years, onco's said i'd never live to see 2012, but i'm still here.  He's miffied, who cares?   Laser can light up areas of invasion of cancer and eradicate.  Docs/Onco's hate laser due to it being so easy, not to mention cheap.  Cancer can bring in anywhere from 1 -2 million, cancer is the gift that keeps on giving, why do you think they build all these cancer centers??  None are better than the ones already here, they all follow the exact protocol.  Surgery, Radiaion, Chemo, Reconstuction, More chemo, it's a merry go round.  Thankful I refused the ride before I ever got on.  Best to you, I know it's not easy.  ck:LaserBreastCancerSurgery.com.   You deserve to be more than a bank deposit slip.
Posts.Title: Calling all alternative cancer treatments experiences...

Posts.Content: Hi Shreeves....Yes, I'm on Aromasin.  I was Dx Stg 4, Breast Cancer last Feb'11 - Opted for Partial Mastectomy via Laser Surgery, I refused Chemo/Radiation, opted for Hormone trmt.  I initially started on Femara & Zometa in June, by Oct I was in hideous pain from the Femara, joints screaming with pain,  along w/overwhelming fatigue, and the continuing hot flashes, plus hair thinning; noticed lots of strands in basin...Oncologist switched me to Aromasin beginning November,also switched to Xgeva to replace Zometa - Love them both, especially being able to get a quickie shot and not have to sit w/a drip.  Absolutely NO S/E's and best part....as of last week had CTscan, results show NO Evidence of Disease NED in my body, only a tiny pinpoint in my spine....I am thrilled.  I've also done lots of supplements, but when I think i've gone from being told "no hope for a future", to being NED -body, which was full of splatters, spots, tumors, invasion in my ribs, pelvis, spine and even my thyroid, which is completely clean---what can I say other than Thank God.    I've had no weight gain, holding steady around 120, but i'm mostly on fruit/veggie diet, salmon.   Hope you will do as well and wishing you lots of success....Cheer.
Posts.Title: Any good reports on taking Aromasin?

Posts.Content: Linda, hard to say much until you know exactly what kind of breast cancer--inflammatory, DCIS, Triple Neg, etc.  Many onco's have now admitted Stage O/DCIS is very likely NOT cancer. Admittedly, it is a precursor, but there are so many very simple procedures that zap it without the invasive biopsies.  I'd advise an ultrasound, mamm's are not the lifesaver touted.  How can I say this?   Because, i've had a mamm every year since my mid 40's, my cancer was misread, then i'm DX'd at Stage 4 - So, I do not have the regard for our medical community some feel I should.  We must be our own advocate.  I urge you to review:  LaserBreastCancerSurgery.com    and if you indeed do need care, this is, without doubt, the absolute best.   I had my treatment there.  No bloodloss, no pain, no need for reconstruction.  There are many onsite that have gone there, Dr. A has thousands of patients who have been given a new life.  It's well past time for our old traditional surgery of complete mastectomy to meet the daylight, there are many easier and more beneficial procedures that are far less traumatic and debilitating that indoor far exceed the old standard of care.
Posts.Title: I said no to rad&chemo

Posts.Content: Has anyone investigated IPT???   It seems to have good success rate, but not covered by insurance, tho some parts are covered, chemo and drugs.   Anyone familiar?
Posts.Title: IPT (Insulin Potential Therapy) success??

Posts.Content: Hi Katherine, I'm always here.  I am amazed how well i've done and continue to do after hearing same line you heard.  So, don't you go believing there is no hope for you.  I know you feel lost, anxious, not a clue where to turn, but first, find a new oncologist - you are paying, educate him/her up front.  I did, they don't like it when you better yourself on your own, but had I not done extensive research,  I would be in the cemetary now.   Good you have gotten sugars out of your diet.  Keep your body alkaline, ph neg, cancer cannot live or thrive in alkaline conditions.  I like CancerTutor.com as it has many good tips.  I have lots of artilces i'd love to send you, Mina Bissell a cancer researcher is a top oncologist who has literally stepped out of the box - she has the right idea, especially when she talks about cancer enviornment.  Akins it to a child (childlren) in a bad enviornment, they will tend to pick up bad habits, same with cancer cells, get the body rid of the unhealthy by boosting the immune system, the healthy cells will influence the making of new cells into "good behavior" cells and the body will thrive.  I can send you gobs of info I've found, plus nutrients such as maitake/shitake/Reishi mushroom extract which for some unknown reason actually kills cancer cells.  Also, Laetrile, apricot pitts known as B17, several others.  I can't, don't offer a cure, I am still battling, but I know I would not be here today if I had not gone on an self education journey.  When I asked my oncologist just exactly what cancer is - he could not answer sensibly.  I have a Masters Degree- albiet it in History/Medievel Literature, but I am not a total idiot, can understand basic instruction, but could tell they have no clue...said " Well, it's lots of things"  no joke.  He had no clue as to the benefit of nutrition in the winning war against cancer.  We have all eaten far too many preservative and additives to food for so long our bodies are oblivious as what and how to react and goes into destruct mode.  Just as they have now realized, the surge in diabetes, with is now our #1 medical malady is due to sugar free drinks, foods, the use of manufactured sugars.  The body has no idea how to process these phony sugars, whether to add insulin, stop production, turn on the fat molecule or what to do, so we must know how and what to do to clean up the mess we have innocently made of our bodies, eat whole foods, lots of vegs/fruits and purified water only-another iffy liquid we have no idea what has been added.  You can email me if you like, I don't post anyone's email, i'm not a business or company, just one person, but will be easy to forward you info directly without taking up so much space here.  Just keep an open mind, and remember, I have never had any chemo, no radiation, refused the mastectomy/lymph removal and in the interim have lost 3 friends from Dx to burial.  One friend dx same week as me, went the whole routine, told in 6 months she was cured, then two months later I attended her funeral, so I know for myself, I have taken the smarter and more beneficial path.  .
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Liver Mets Survivors

Posts.Content: Hi Katherine, you must have gone to same oncologist I visited - three years ago.   Told me - Sorry, nothing we can do for you, go home and plan your funeral.  Sorry I can't post the words I'd really like to describe these two (both the onco & radiologist - you know, oncologists come in pairs) idiots.  I'm sure there are good onco's out there, sadly, i've not found them, they all read from the same playbook, will tell you, we have to follow protocol?  Hummm....who wrote that book?  I did my own research, followed my own game plan, so guess maybe those words were good to hear, or I would be toast now.  Within 3 months, after being DX'd as Stage 4 (Due to genuis who misread my mammograms) mets to spine, ribs, pelvis, liver,lungs, thyroid, basal cell on scalp, I had eradicated ALL METS to soft tissue.  NADA - nothing in liver, lungs and even the ribs, still some invasion in spine and pelvis.  Since, have gone on one round of cesium chloride and most of pelvis andn spine clear, will start again soon to finish the job.  We are being a sold a bill of erroneous BS-Cancer is 6.5 Billion Dollar a year business, no one really wants a cure, they just want the money for othe research and promotion of continued care to keep the wheels greased and turning.  Sad, but true,  I did the research, I have done extensive reading, what I find is nauseating. Cancer numbers are not falling, they are rising - just as we put more money into education, we get dumber kids....something is amiss with thinking money is the remedy.  When a novice as myself in the world of medicine is able to rid cancer with the use of simple baking soda and maple syrup, then proceed to cut the bone invasion by 60%, someone is not being truthful.  I can prove my success--cancer stats cannot.  The way the come up with stats is mind boggling.  Talk about mind games!  It's up to you to save yourself, but it can be done.  Google JimKelmunProtocol, laugh, then get angry, then laugh some more, but - eventually you will try it, and you will be successful.  This treatment causes apoptosis in the body, many hospitals now do IPT which is a form of this same treatment, but not for the pennies it costs, for thousands, plus!   Also did many cancer specific nutrients, and changed my diet.  It is very important you understand how the body works.  If you think I'm full of it, then just do your own thing, if you are interested, I will send you what I did and refer you to other sites...there is no charge, I'm just a breastcancer grandma who refuses to hear more garbage, fortunately I grew up when the world really did believe in common sense.  Whatever, just know I wish you the best.  I do have to admit though, when my doc suggested I have surgical mastectomy, lymphs removed, chemo---the whole routine, I looked at him like he was out of his mind.  I opted for LaserBreastSurgery, it is what really saved my life.  But, you can win.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Liver Mets Survivors

Posts.Content: God Bless - so good to hear from someone enlightened!   Yes, I am aware of all you mentioned,  I chucked all the "whites" sugar/refined ingredients.  Nothing like Mommy Nature to keep us well balanced - eating the natural foods and as many in natural form.   So good to have a pleasant reply, I mostly get "hate" mail, accusatory that I am leading people to destruction.   We both know we have our own brain and our own free will and there are those of us who want to know ALL we can and then make our decision.   If Jesicha is overwhelmed and you feel she is slipping, check out CesiumChloride.  It is eradicating my bone mets, all others are already gone.  It is a boggiebear, but seems to be working.  If you can find Kathleen Douel's Book: GENOCIDE - The Cancer Cover Up, grab it, read it.  The line from the book  that is so embossed in my head is the statement from FDA exec's on use of DMSO and Cesium -  Well, we know it works, but we don't know how, so therefore we cannot approve it for consumption!   What genuises - I can bet you if THEY or THEIR loved ones  stricken with cancer, they will be the first to go for the Cesium!    I will keep you and Jes in my prayers as I do all who have encountered this awful disease, but I also know, you and I and many, are much further ahead than the standard medical "protocol" only believers - .  Bless you.       - Also, any time googling for products,  add cancer to search, ie:  FUCOIDAN CANCER - you get a better listing.   Good luck, keep me posted on progress and if you have any tips, I'm always receptive!
Posts.Title: how long does a person survive once cancer has spread into different parts of the body

Posts.Content: Visited Jesicha's site, truly a beautiful tribute to her fight, and you as well deserve much acknowledgement for your never ending support and fight along with her.  THere is nothing that can ever compare to a mothers love and determination to save their child.  God Bless, I know Jesicha only knows peace and the most abundant and beautiful love imanigable.  That pain never leaves, we learn to live with it, but there is nothing to ever take the emptiness of holding those we loved so much and are now part of God's kingdom.   We lost our son in 2004 to lung cancer, a beautiful young man, could make anyone smile and laugh, added so much goodness to any gathering.   One day, we will understand how all these pieces of pain, joy, laughter, sadness,fit together to create life.... life never dies.   Peace and thanks to you for such a loving tribute.....
Posts.Title: how long does a person survive once cancer has spread into different parts of the body

Posts.Content: So good to hear your daughter getting great results with the alternative - me too.   I was told i'd be "lights out" as of Nov. 2011 - here it is May, 2013 and I am in great health, still Stage 4 BC, but all stats, bloodwork perfect and my tumor markers are all UNDER the normal readings!  I feel good, no fatigue, no pain.  I was DX'd w/BC in Jan/2011 after having a mamm only 14 months earlier and told all A-ok, then find I am Stage4, mets to thyroid, basal cell, liver, lungs, ribs, spine and pelvis.  I had completely eradicated ALL tumors in the soft tissue, liver, etc, by Sept 2011 using Alternative.  Now even the bone mets are slowly disappearing.   It can be done.  I had to use some powerful ingredients, lost my voice for awhile, but returned in 6 mo's, a small price to pay for the overall results.   I get lots of grief from lots of people for going alternative, but I was given no hope and here I have saved myself.  I have had NO chemo, NO radiation.  I have read over 50 books on cancer, got stats from NCI, what i've learned turned my stomach.  Cancer is a money maker for the pharm co's and hospitals, and....sadly, there is a cure, but to use it would close the doors of most hospitals.  I personally could care less what people say to or about me, I am alive, in great shape.  Even my doc finally admitted, yes, we can only do what is "protocol" - one size fits all, paint everyone with the same brush from the same paint can....it just doesn't work.   I've got the stats, for every cure from chemo, there are 67 bodies that fail from treatment.   Most cures are Stage 1 & 2, go to Stage 3 & 4, the cures are very far and few between.....and, from my viewpoint, you can cure 1 & 2 with alternative quite easily.   So stay diligent, it's worked and still working for me.   I pray enlightment will reign over monetary gain; but, I don't hold my breath, I know human fraility is easily swayed by the powerful.     Ck out U-Fn, DIM and of course Curcumin, add to her regimine, also remember cancer is anaerobic, not bacterial or viral, so get on a good diet, avoid the sugar - yes, avoid the sugar, it feeds cancer and don't let anyone dissuade you.  Avoid milk, soy and glutemates.   Add prayer in abundance, it is quite powerful.  Blessings to you.
Posts.Title: how long does a person survive once cancer has spread into different parts of the body

Posts.Content: From what I can see, Tarceva is for non small cell lung cancer, used after regimine of platinum based chemotherapy.   I really don't know much about chemo, other than they are very destructive to DNA and cell structure and I refused chemo or radiation, well....refused everything- no mastectomy, reconstruction or lymph node removal.   Lots has to do with the specific type cancer you have, I have the most common DCIS all positive, but it is Stage 4.   I've long wondered how I lost my friend last March, she and I had same identical cancer and dx'd within a week of each other, then she discovered she was Stage 2, I was Stage 4!   Seems very weird to me that she went thru all the hell of chemo,surgery, radiaition, reconstruction and pronouced CURED in July.   She kept trying to talk me into going her route, but I never felt comfortable with the regimine, then this past February she had recurrence, they started her on Gemzar and in March she passed.    She was then Stage 3.  I always thought you had to go thru all stages, but I believe it was the chemo that caused her demise just as I feel it does for lots of victims.   I can only tell you I am doing great, no ill effects, all bloodwork, stats are perfect.   Cancer is different in each individual, but it is alike in that diet plays a major role in the healing process.  I avoid sugar which feeds the beast, soy, glutemates, etc. and stick to whole/natural foods and load up on the disease specific nutrients.  As for the amts, your body weight will dictate, I am 122lbs, take at least 1,000mg Fucoidan, 200mg Beta Glucan, 1000mg Laetrile/B17, and I take the combo of Reishi/Maitake/Shitake Mushroom 1000mg.  Others just the suggested on the bottle--Selenium, Iodine, Zinc, Maagnesium, Calcium -1000 - 1200mg daily, VitD-3 -2000mg, Curcurmin/Tumeric -don't understimate the power of this golden wonder - 2,500mg.  If you aren't doing the Bk Soda/MapleSyrup, you should try it for 6 weeks, cheap, but very effective and easy.   Don't know  how I thought you were in the Uk, but I correspond with a friend there and must have gotten confused - happens lots!  Just don't let this beast yank you around.  We are conditioned to believe it is the worst thing that could ever happen, and, probably is, but I will fight till my last breath and continue to research and learn all I can.   I urge you to search for Dr. Ben Goldacre and Dr. Mina Bissell at the TED conference.  QUITE an eye opener, if you cannot find, buzz me and i'll forward to you.   They are cancer researchers that refuse to be muzzled by the Pharmacy companies and have the proof that shows most of what we are being forced to undergo is doing much more harm than good.   Sending best, stay strong!
Posts.Title: desperate for advice re denosumab

Posts.Content: Suebo, Yes, there are many alternative sites, and many are to be very wary of.  I didn't just dive in without indepth study and many questions, just as you.   I think it's best to look for cures for your 'cancer specific" type...brain, breast, etc.  As well as with me, breast cancer--DCIS.  I know that inflammatory breast cancer and Triple Negative are really beastly and need a very strict regimine.  Looking back on what i've done, don't think I had such a bumpy road.  I figured since 5 oncologists had already told me to "prepare" with at most 18 months, I had nothing to lose.  Here it is 36 months later and all tumor markers are normal, two under the normal, all bloodwork, stats perfect, no fatigue, no pain and if I don't think about that beast, hardly know I've been bitten.  I'm certainly not bragging, I am just thankful God has smiled on me and allowed me to find the right road to travel.  Cancer is nothing to be "bravado" about, it is a disgusting, low life beast that robs not only the sufferer, but destroys friendships and family ties in many instances.  I have been lucky that I have good family that has hauled me up on those miserasble days.  My daughter was with me from time I was DX'd, never fails to call.  My son as well, and my dear daughter in law.  I have the best husband I could ever hope for, so considerate and caring....I feel awful for him.  This is our second marriage, he lost his first wife from breast cancer; she was only 34, leaving him with 2 small boys....and not a clue where to pick up, but we put a wonderful family together with my two and his two, then again the scum beast reared it's ugly head and took our son at 42 with lung cancer, such a dear young man in his prime with so much to live for...so, I am not frivilous in my thinking.   I do know from all the books i've read that cancer is indeed Anaerobic, and only a good diet can combat that particular illness, so immediately I went on strict diet and have kept my body alkaline.  It was a bit hard at first, but now just seems natural.  I can only tell you what i've done, be wary of those clinic's in Mexico, they will bleed you dry and you can do the same thing at home for a few hundred dollars where they will charge you upwards of $50,000 - yes, Fifty Thousand, plus, plus, plus.  I know people who have gone and they are no better off.  Just do the simple things i've done, they work just as well.  I can send you a copy of my scan report and tumor markers/bloodwork.  I do not lie about such a serious condition.  First, start with the Jim Kelmum Protocol...google it.  That got all the cancer out of my soft tissue, lungs, liver, etc.    If you want me to send you list of nutrients, will be very happy to do so.  Very simple, and as I mentioned, very inexpensive.  I may have spent around $80.00 to get started, then just replenish as needed.   If you've heard of IPT therapy, such as the Linchitz Clinic in NewYork-LinchitzWellness.com     Jim Kelmun Protocol is much the same, only dirt cheap, but it works.  If you've had any chemistry, even high school, remember how baking soda activates in liquid and creates oxygen...does the same in your body.  Cancer cells are killed by oxygen.   Just let me know if you want the entire "what I did" will be glad to email to you....no, money not involved, just a bit wordy and don't want to take up so much room on here, also, you'd be surprised how hostile people are when you say alternative, yet I don't see any great cures with chemo.   Nor did my friend who was Dx'd same week as me.  She went the whole way, mastectomy/Lymph node removal, chemo, radiation, reconstruction, then death.   She was only Stage 3 when Dx'd, I was Stage 4.  She passed a year later, i'm still here.  I take NO joy in that, but I do know doc's are painting everyone with the same brush from the same paint can knowing it doesn't work.  I opted for LaserSurgery to have my tumor and all the smaller tumors and splatters as well as only 5 lymph nodes removed and I know that was the saving grace.  Without what I call the Mother Ship spewing cancer cells into the body, seems easy to understand why i've had such good results.   Anyone can, i'm no genuis, but I love myself enough to want to know, learn and then do all I can to enjoy my family and friends as long as possible.  I know Christ is my goal, but I think He put a brain in our head to use at times like these, and i've sure been thru the lessons.    Just let me know if you want a list of the nutrients and what I did, very simple, easy and for me, very effective.   Blessings.
Posts.Title: how long does a person survive once cancer has spread into different parts of the body

Posts.Content: I'm on Xgeva (Denosumab), also Femara.  Previously on Zometa, recently replacled w/Xgeva as Oncologist feels it offers much better results.  I've had no "additional" side effects since replacing Xgeva vs. Zometa.  I like Xgeva, so much easier, a quickie shot w/extra fine needle into tummy top layer of flesh, can hardly feel it, beats sitting for 30 minutes with a drip.  I have no doubt that it is the Femara that is causing my debilitating fatigue, hotfllashes, bone pain and now see hair falling out.  What a thrill. Orig dx Jan/11, refused traditional slice/dice mastectomy/lymph node removal, but did opt for laser surgery and had partial mastectomy and 5 lymph nodes removed, only 4 pos.  Wow, so easy, no cutting, NO PAIN, even tho mets in body, i'm better off as didn't have to go thru the misery of surgical recuperation.  I refused chemo and radiation.   I can tell you that in June'11, had scans that showed mets everywhere, liver, lungs, pelvis, ribs, spine, splatters throughout as well....then in Sept '11, my follow up scans showed NO Tumors, all bone mets gone except tiny spot on my T-7 area spine, but reduced greatly....so, of course medical will say, see, Zometa, Xgeva and Femara working, yeah?  Well, you told me i'd be dead if I didn't do the Chemo or Radiation and i'm doing great, all bloodwork, vitals perfect, tumor markers falling like a rock, My CEA 2.7 (norm 3.4), CA-15 down to 60 and CA25 down to 80, so how do they account for that???- I credit Curcumin w/Tumeric, Indole 3/Carbinol, Fucoidan, Iodine and other ssupplements.   When you read up on these you see they actually go after cancer cells, in fact now Sloan Kettering doing big time studies w/Fucoidan.  I can send you links if you like, but to get back to denosumab, don't worry, unless you have serious dental problems or renal problems, you'll be fine.  The bloodwork will show if you are or are not a good candidate.  As for me, at this  time will stick w/Xgeva, just wishI could ditch the Femara....it's the boogeyman that hides under the bed, only it's for real.   Good luck.
Posts.Title: desperate for advice re denosumab

Posts.Content: Never like to think others are in such pain, I know it's unbearable at times, but I don't think you will find the denosumab makes you any worse.   Believe me, it's that tiny monster pill Femara causing all the misery.  I forgot to take it with me on trip, by 3rd day I felt like putting on my dancing shoes--no bone pain or discomfort; then reality set in when I got home and had to take my meds, but in just 3 missed days could tell such a difference, was like I was free with no ills at all..... I know the radiation trmts are giving you misery too, I refused chemo & rad, but i've been with dear friends thru their battle, the pain can get quite intense.  Be sure to get Iodine supplements, they will kill the free radicals in your bod after all the radiation exposure you've been thru.  You should be taking Vicodin or something that will ease that discomfort, don't be afraid to speak up, you need something to ease your pain, will help you relax and get thru those moments.  Hate you are having nausea, thats horrid, i've not had that delight, but i'm enjoying watching my hair fall out....who put these blasted spells on us anyway?   You just hang in there, know you have great support here and aren't alone in this stew.
Posts.Title: desperate for advice re denosumab

Posts.Content: hi platopotato...hope you are feeling little better.  Shocked to think you can't get vicodin or something similar, it's not nearly as powerful as morphine or even percocet, I only take a half when needed, usually find that Excedrin does almost as good, but at those "times" when the muscle and bone pain are so excruciatingly horrendous, believe me i'm not going to sit him in abject horror until it passes.   So hard for others to understand until they are in our shoes, you hang in there, at least try Excedrin if available there, works really good for me.   anything new going on with you?  We'll get thru this and we'll be stronger, just read somewhere that the more pain you have from Femara or Xgeva, the more likey of a remission and less chance of recurrence....so keep repeating that on those days you have the worst ills.   Sending cheer and hope you have better day today and hereafter....
Posts.Title: desperate for advice re denosumab

Posts.Content: Hi abu1715 - i'm not at all familiar with Tachiva.  Since you are in UK, it must be similiar to drug here by another name.  When you return for your next onco visit, ask for an info sheet on the drug, side effcts/efficacy, etc.  Don't ever fear asking any questions, it's YOUR body, you live in it and know how you feel.   I have the advantage of being 68 and the one of the joys of being older is noting stands in the way of speaking up and asking questions.   I am always very polite, I don't believe in belittling or being rude, but I, WE, all need to know what these drugs are doing to our body, not just immediate, but long term.   I am now on Aromasin, switched from Femara and love it, NO s/e's, very easy for me to tolerate.  Still on Xgeva but will start in May on 3 mo intervals rather than monthly, then 6 mo's, once yearly and hopefully i'm done.   I have started the CesiumChloridie and last scan showed "zilch" tumors or splatter spots anywhere in the body except the very tiny spot still in my spine, but even it has diminished in size....then the good news, radiologist not sure if it is Arthritis or cancer - I have osteoarthrtiis (over 15 years), plus two fused spinal vetebrae, so i'm hoping it is arthritis - never thought i'd wish for that, but sure beats cancer invasion.    Do hope you are and will continue to make good progress.   Stay on whole foods, avoid sugars, glutemates, soy, milk products.   Go to CancerTutor.com , read up on your particular cancer and review all the good choices.   People got a good belly laugh when I started on the simple baking soda/Maple Syrup, but I am having the last laugh.  Who's to say that just because something is so simple, cheap and easy that it is not effective?   The reasoning behind this "easy to do" makes lots of sense.   Sure worked for me!   Good Luck.
Posts.Title: desperate for advice re denosumab

Posts.Content: Yes - Me!  Was told over 5 years ago I had BC -STAGE 4!   Also told to go home and get my affairs in order, enjoy the next year or two, said i'd never last past Novermber, 2011.  I have DCIS/Stage4, yet, all my TM's are normal, doc's all have egg on their face. Onco's said I should have the tumor out as it was quite large, also do a complete mastectomy.  Well - no thanks.  I did opt for Laser Surgery and I know without a doubt it saved my life.  I did tons of research, you have to know exactly what you are dealing with, each of us is different, yet medical only knows how to paint everyone with the same brush from the same paint can.  Google-- Mina Bissell/TEDTALKS, she is a top cancer researcher, yet no one listens in the medical field, it is filled with jealousy and pharmaceutical industry/FDA mandates and none are about saving lives, they are all about $$$ -  Also - go to LaserBreastCancerSurgery.com   Dr. Ansanelli.  Get the tumor out, clean out the area -without surgery,pain, mutilation, reconstruction - keep  your own equipment!  avoid the chance of cancer cells spilling into  your lymph & blood system to set up housekeeping elswhere in the body.  View the video, self explanatory.  I have had 7 oncologists tell me my life was over.  I'm still healthy, no pain, do have invasion in my spine,but when I left the initial visit, I had cancer everywhere, lungs, liver, pelvis, spine, you name it, I had it----even a basal cell carcinoma on my scalp, which I had excised.  It too was breast cancer.  That was 2011, well, it's 2014, i'm thriving.  I got 100% of the cancer out of my soft tissue in 60 days.  My onco nearly fell off his chair.  You have to be determined, I am, I'll just be damed if i'll turn my life over to anyone or anything, it will have to fight a lot harder to take me down.  I did my homework, I have read over 60 books/periodicals, information of any kind I can find.  Most is a bunch of hooey, I am shocked how little the cancer industry actually does to cure cancer.  But, reading that 78% of oncologists said they would refuse chemo or radiation if they got cancer, really turned the lights on for me.  They know it is a killer, yet the continue to spoon feed it to patients, without every trying anything less destructive.  The onco's I visited couldn't even tell me what cancer is - that old song and dance routine, it's a cell that goes haywire?   Really, if that were true, our entire body would become one big, gigantic cancer cell!   We'd look like chewbacca from Star Wars.  You can beat cancer, i'm no genuis, but at least i'm an alive "ungenuis".   I know the body must be ph negative.  Cancer cannot live or thrive in an alkaline body.  I got my tumor markers normal, got all the soft tissue cancer kaput by using the alkaline diet...NO SUGAR---another ridiculous simple rule doc's seem to have missed along the way.  Cancer feeds off sugar, milk, soy---yes, soy, after cancer, avoid soy.  It's your choice.  But I've never had any chemo, no surgery, only laser, which is painless, takes 30 minutes while you sleep, then get up and continue with whatever you were doing before going to sleep.  It's more effective than surgial removal, but, it's cheap.  Cancer is the gift that keeps on giving, keeps the hospital doors swinging both ways all day long.  Yes, I'm disgusted, i've watched several friends, family, all die because the NCIS/American Cancer/all the pink ribbon organizations saying they are curing cancer every day?  Really?   The real rates are going up.  But a new cancer patient is another Million$/plus.  You just have to put yourself first, and second and only.   Do whatYOURhead tells you, not someone who isn't going through what  you are.    Whatever your choice, yes, there are many who have said NO, i'm one, I know many others.  At Stage 4, I think I know a little about of which I speak, so do your homework and don't be bashful.  There's only one of you, you are important,  you count and should know there is much you can do to kill the beast, and kill it without killing yourself!
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer/ with no treatment

Posts.Content: Know you are traumatized with the cancer diagnosis...extend my sympathies in the loss your your husband and previous loss of your sister.   I recvd my cancer diagnosis this past Feb.  I could not swallow the "cut the entire breast, take all the lymph nodes, chemo, radiation".   Guess i'm a weenie, but I opted for Laser Surgery.   I still have most of my breast, was a partial mastectomy, only 5 lymph nodes removed.  No pain, no cutting, no misery.  I recvd 2 in clear margins and glad I went that route....check out Laser Breast Cancer Surgery Center/Dr. Vincent Ansanelli.   I'd heard anytime you cut there is chance of spillage of cancer cells and I felt more comfortable with my decision, which has been good for me.  You can call and talk w/them at no charge, they will answer all questions, no pushing, just full info.   I am 67, so you should do as well as I have.   Good luck, just keeping looking forward, it's a struggle, but every day will be little easier.
Posts.Title: need to talk

Posts.Content: Hilde, you mentioned your onco would not do mastectomy to opposite breast/right side?  If there is no cancer or tumor, it is understandable.  Is there a tumor, or are you concerened that cancer will appear at some time?  It also may not....all of us who have, or are in remission, always carry the fear of a return.  Where do you stand now?  Are you in remission now?  Where did you have remission? - Breast, or had it spread?  I now have no cancer in any soft tissue, prior was covered in 8 -9mm tumors in liver, lungs, etc., but now only in the bone/spine, but the csci is slowing eradicatiing.  God Bless, stay positive and be determined!  Sending all the best.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer/ with no treatment

Posts.Content: Would benefit to watch the video on Mina Bissell/TED conference. She is an onco/researcher.  Onco's are in the dark ages, still say it's one cell that goes haywire. That thinking is so wrong. As i've said prior, if that were so, we'd all look like Chewbacca on starwars, one gigantic cancer cell. That's not how the body works. Any diet that keeps the body PHneg will surfice, add AlkaMax drops to your beverages, continue to avoid sugars, soy and consume fresh fruits veggies.  Very little meat, limited chicken and make fish the first choice.  Diets do help, but any that are healthy will work.   Google MinaBissell Ted Conference.  SHe is brilliant, hated by most of the established, so called "cancer centers.  She is on the right road, sadly, most oncologists are in the dark, they all learn from one playbook, can only do one trick and yet they convince themselves they are saving lives....real stats don't lie, they aren't.  If I hear "protocol" once more time, i'm going to throw up on the souce.  another name for protocol, which is what all the "march step" onco community follow is just another name for we don't know what to do, so we will follow what is beaten into us a med school, it works once in a while and even if it doesn't, we can't be sued, it's protocol!
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer/ with no treatment

Posts.Content: From what I can see, Tarceva is for non small cell lung cancer, used after regimine of platinum based chemotherapy.   I really don't know much about chemo, other than they are very destructive to DNA and cell structure and I refused chemo or radiation, well....refused everything- no mastectomy, reconstruction or lymph node removal.   Lots has to do with the specific type cancer you have, I have the most common DCIS all positive, but it is Stage 4.   I've long wondered how I lost my friend last March, she and I had same identical cancer and dx'd within a week of each other, then she discovered she was Stage 2, I was Stage 4!   Seems very weird to me that she went thru all the hell of chemo,surgery, radiaition, reconstruction and pronouced CURED in July.   She kept trying to talk me into going her route, but I never felt comfortable with the regimine, then this past February she had recurrence, they started her on Gemzar and in March she passed.    She was then Stage 3.  I always thought you had to go thru all stages, but I believe it was the chemo that caused her demise just as I feel it does for lots of victims.   I can only tell you I am doing great, no ill effects, all bloodwork, stats are perfect.   Cancer is different in each individual, but it is alike in that diet plays a major role in the healing process.  I avoid sugar which feeds the beast, soy, glutemates, etc. and stick to whole/natural foods and load up on the disease specific nutrients.  As for the amts, your body weight will dictate, I am 122lbs, take at least 1,000mg Fucoidan, 200mg Beta Glucan, 1000mg Laetrile/B17, and I take the combo of Reishi/Maitake/Shitake Mushroom 1000mg.  Others just the suggested on the bottle--Selenium, Iodine, Zinc, Maagnesium, Calcium -1000 - 1200mg daily, VitD-3 -2000mg, Curcurmin/Tumeric -don't understimate the power of this golden wonder - 2,500mg.  If you aren't doing the Bk Soda/MapleSyrup, you should try it for 6 weeks, cheap, but very effective and easy.   Don't know  how I thought you were in the Uk, but I correspond with a friend there and must have gotten confused - happens lots!  Just don't let this beast yank you around.  We are conditioned to believe it is the worst thing that could ever happen, and, probably is, but I will fight till my last breath and continue to research and learn all I can.   I urge you to search for Dr. Ben Goldacre and Dr. Mina Bissell at the TED conference.  QUITE an eye opener, if you cannot find, buzz me and i'll forward to you.   They are cancer researchers that refuse to be muzzled by the Pharmacy companies and have the proof that shows most of what we are being forced to undergo is doing much more harm than good.   Sending best, stay strong!
Posts.Title: desperate for advice re denosumab

Posts.Content: Yes, you are on the right track...Good you know about Fucoidan, I've been on it 5 years. Add Miatake/Reishi/Shitake Mushroom capsules as well. I am Stg4 BC er/pr pos.  I think the thing that saved me was my refusal for traditional surgical mastectomy.  I opted for laser surgery to remove my tumor...no pain, no cutting, no chance of cancer cells escaping from surgery and setting up in other parts of the body. Had laser surgery in NY/Onco there has been doing laser for many years, twice named Doctor of the Year in NY. (Laserbreastcancersurgery.com)  Has better long term cure results than cut & slice mutilate.  It is disgusting how onco's will not accept laser, but then, it is all about the money.   You have to be persistent in your search, learn all you can.  Also, google Mina Bissell/TED...she is a top onco researcher -  Explains how the body can cure itself.  So far, working for me.  ADD...Tumeric - a wonder nutrient, IP6 & Inositol, and very certainly add B17/Amagdalin, plus Apricot seed pitts.  Now entering year 6, no problems, all tumor markers/bloodwork/stats normal.  I do have invasion in my spine, so I know I have to be persistent and stay ahead.   had 8 -9mm tumors in soft tissue-liver, lungs, etc. All those are gone!!!   I've never had chemo or radiation.  YES Baking Soda is a wonder, go to Kelman Protocol.com    I know how you feel, every day is a battle.  If you want, I can send you list of all supplements I take, they have helped me, plus which diet will keep cancer at bay - it's a ph neg diet.  Cancer cannot live in an oxygenated enviornment, so get the body ph- I try to stay ahead of the beast, my husband lost his first wife to breast cancer at 38, leaving him with two young sons. We  lost of one those boys ten years ago to lung cancer, I refuse to let cancer dictate my life.  Stay strong. God Bless.

Posts.Title: Breast Cancer/ with no treatment

Posts.Content: Vickie, don't despair!  I'm going on 5 plus years with Stg4BC.  Don't think of it as a death sentence, all life inevitably ends, but what we, and you, must do now is be determined.   I was told go home and die several times, well, I've got my own agenda thank you, I have found overly glorified oncologists do not have a clue.  They only read stats, follow protocol, twiddle thumbs inbetween, but when it comes to, as they say, where the rubber meets the road, they are absolutely clueless. Know what you are fighting.  All cancers are different, and even in their category: breast, colon, lung, etc., they are different.  In breast cancer you have inflammatory, DCIS, Triple Neg, etc.  You have to know what you need to do for your "specific" type.  I have read, researched, studied and then had to excuse myself for a big bout of throwup at the BS we are being handed.  First, i'd advise you to google and read MinaBissell/TedConference.  She can explain how the body can defend and repair itself to fight cancer.   I had 8 & 9mm tumors everywhere in my body, lungs, liver, ribs, invasion.  Was told "No way you can survive with the tumors in your body....ummm-that was Jan, 2011.  Now,  all my bloodwork is perfect, no cancer in soft tissue  and I have no intention of having someone  tell me ever again, i'm sorry, but you need to consider making plans for your funeral.  Maybe because "they" haven't a clue, nor do they intend to do more than is written and put under their nose, doesn't mean we cannot be our own advocates.  Get the main tumor out, in simple verbage, it's a like a mother ship spewing new cancer cells, but, as you will hear from Mina Bissell, a top cancer researcher/geneticist, if you clean out the body, repair and get your immune system in top working order, it will prevent cancer cells to thrive in the body.  She akins it to a child placed in a destructive enviornment, chances are, the child will be destructive. Place a child in a loving and healthy enviornment, best chances it too will become healthy and loving.   Just remember --cancer cannot thrive or live in an alkaliine enviornment (oxygenated) enviornment.  You can do it if you are determined.  Any good, basic, sugar free, soy and milk free diet, heavy on fruits and veggies is all you need to do, plus get the right supplements. I'm no genuis, but when I read how influential pharmacy co's and medical doga determine our course of survival, I'm just not willing to place my life in some disinterested party's hand.  Sadly, if you research,  you will fiind it is all about the $$$  Cancer is the gift that keeps on giving, cancer dx can bring in a million plus, yet with no guarantee of success.  WEll, so can a healthy diet and it doesn't destroy the body in the interim with poisonous chemo drugs.  It's all about choice, just as life is, we  make our choices to do or not do, which to me is the greatest gift we ever receive in life.  Who loves us more than ourselves?  We live in this body, no one else has the same investment.  My doc has finally admitted that I have done an amazing job at keeping my body healthy and thriving.  How long?  Who knows?  For sure onco's don't.  All I know is I am healthy today, plan to be tomorrow and i'll just be d-----d if i'll let someone who doesn't know me or care about me or my family tell me to go home and plan my funeral.  Hey, I can tell them the same thing!  Get good supplements and a good alkaline diet and start beating the beast back into it's underground cave.  Remember, there is only one of you and you are important and you count!   God Bless.
Posts.Title: Dealing with Stage IV metastic cancer and the emotions that come with it.

Posts.Content: Hard to comment wihtout knowing all that was involved? Did you have lymph nodes removed? Scar tissue runs deep, any movement with tissue, tendon connection is going to "feel" the sensation, usually a stinging, from movement.  It very possibly will go away, or at least diminish in time.  Be very thankful your tumor biopsy was benign, many of us can only wish we had heard the same.  In future, do your research prior to any,--ANY procedures.  Will save you many tears and wishings "if only i'd known".  For any future radiation, ck on proton beam, for any future breast involvement, ck LaserBreastCancerSurgery for a non pain removal of tumor, and much better end result than traditional mastectomy.  Your onco will not lead you to the best decision, they are requiqred to give the medical regimine, research shows that is not always,but is usually,  the worst route.  Be wise, it's your body, you live in it, you deserve the best care.  Best of luck.

Posts.Title: Wife with breast cancer, desperate to try any "natural" drugs

Posts.Content: I did read Jesicha's Story, as you just posted re: onco's who think we are invisible, talk to others, but not directly to us.  I assume they think we are mental pygmies, but the truth be told, they are the ones "in the dark"  can only see what med school & pharmacies tell them....that is, until "they" find the beast in their body or a loved one.  I don't know how you have found it in your heart to forgive the care, or lack of interest which equals care, to those that shuttled Jesicha around like a file folder/Good Insurance Card, so many see when they are looking at a cancer patient.  What I find so grossly saddening is how many people immediately panic when they are DX'd.  Onco's love a panicked patient...they are like putty in their hands, willing to do anything offered thinking it is their ONLY chance.  I've read so many posts of people dreading their upcoming mastectomy, chemo, reconstruction, radiation, etc.  BUT, i've posted the laser sight, which offers a pain free solution and has a much better track record at eradicating the cancer and an extremely higher rate of no recurrence, yet --- onco's win, I'm just thankful i've always been known as stubborn, or I too would be a statistic.  I'm so heartbroken that our medical/pharm industry thinks so little of the plight of cancer patients.  There is no reason they cannot offer Laser Surgery and save the mutilation of women and the misery and pain of recuperation from surgery, chemo,, radiation and reconstruction.  The only reason --Money - old fashioned greed.  Very sad indeed.  God Bless, at least we know Jesicha is safe in the hands of God and now only knows bliss and neverending joy.  It is those of us left behind that suffer the loss daily.....Blessings to you.
Posts.Title: Dealing with Stage IV metastic cancer and the emotions that come with it.

Posts.Content: emilyw85 - radiation damage is quite common.  No onco is going to be completely honest with you, many men with prostate cancer suffer incontinence, inpotence and other health problems, women must worry about liver, lung and heart damage when BC radiation is given.  Radiation causes muscle tissue to harden, therefore causing stress on the heart to pump.  I have refused radiation, but then I refused chemo too. In future, look at Proton therapy.  I am now considering as SE's are few and far between.  Try to boost your immune system as best you can to reboot your entire body.  Get on a good diet and check with a nutrition specialist for supplements that can repair some of the damage.  Best of luck, once the onco's are done with us, luck is really all that's left.  As in any war, truth is the 1st casualty, certainly true in cancer.
Posts.Title: Liver damage after having radiation for breast cancer

Posts.Content: Before you decide on a definite route, check into Dr. Ansanelli in NewYork, LaserBreastCancerSurgery.com    I went there, there is little cutting to remove the tumor.  I had tumors everywhere, doc's wanted to take entire breast and all lymph nodes.  Dr. Ansanelli only took 5, 4 were positive the 5th was clean and clear and no need to take more.   He has been doing breast surgery for 30 years, has been chosen Doctor of the Year twice in New York State, has practiced in NewYork City hospitals and is well respected.   I was frantic, could not face this debilitating and mutilating surgery, then the reconstruction.   I am so glad I did.   I had friend DX'd same time as me in Jan, 2011.   She died after chemo and radiation, I have had NO chemo or radiation, my tumor markers are normal, all bloodwork/stats normal, scans show no cancer in any soft tissue, and I was covered in mets - 9mm in liver, lungs, thyroid, ribs, pelvis and spine.  Now only a small spot left in my spine.   At least check out the web site, save yourself lots of misery, I did.  I just wish someone had told me, but at least God answered my prayers and I managed to find him online after two days on constant searching for some alternative.  I called, he talked to me several times at no charge, no pressure, answered all questions.   You owe it to yourself to at least know there is an easier way.   Godspeed, blessings to you.
Posts.Title: Ductual Carcinoma in Situ.

Posts.Content: If you decide on surgery, which is the standard oncologists suggestion, you should at least visit LaserBreastCancersurgery.com    I bypassed the slice and dice mastectomy,  only needed 4 lymph nodes removed instead of medical taking all and leaving the chance of  lymphodema which is very debilitating.  I've had no chemo, radition and of course no need for reconstruction as the laser goes after the cancer by ablation and zaps it.  Since there is no pain,  I was able to get up and walk off the op table, since then, all tumor are below the norms, all soft tissue is clean and clear.  I am going on my 5th year of being clear of this beast, had I gone the medical route, i'd be in my grave, doc's said I would be dead by November, 2011.   The secret is getting the main tumor our and all the splatter/spots -smaller cancer cells.  Medical procedures cannot do this.  When you cut, you allow fluids with cancer cells to escape and set up housekeeping in other areas of the body.  Laser is being used quite widely now in Europe, but naturally the U.S. is sadly always the last to come on board.  It's is your choice and your body, but I know many who have gone laser and we are all still here, sadly, two of my friends, one dx's same week as me, went the med route, surgery, chem/rad/reconstruction but....I attended her funeral two years ago.  At least do the research, Laser is so easy and much more effective than the debilitating and painful traditional surgery.  I sat with two friends who underwent this miserable surgery,  it is not fun,  glad I did tho, as got me doing the research when I heard those words spoken to me.    I am stage 4, due to a misread mamm, no way I would trust so calleld medical geniuses after that blunder, then to hear the hideous explanations of what procedures they had in store for me...no thanks.  They all said i'd be dead by end of the year, now they have no idea where to list me, tumor markers are normal, no cancer can be detected on scans, all bloodwork, stats are perfect.  Do still have a much reduced spot on spine, which I am still treating w/cesiumchloride.  Your choice, your pain or your easy do...LaserBreastCancersurgery.com   Dr. Ansanelli was twice honored as doctor of the year in New York, has severed in many of the top hospitals in NewYork City, where he now practices, as well as office/clinic in LongIsland.  I'm so thankful I found him, have made several friends on line who have gone as well, we are all thriving.  The only reason hospitals will not use is it is too cheap, they'd much rather have the $200 - $500 Thousand.  Can't compete with Laser which is under $10K.  You owe it to yourself to at least do the research.
Posts.Title: Ductual Carcinoma in Situ.

Posts.Content: hi misscee, hope you are recuperating from your surgery and all went well and you are feeling okay.   Sending cheer and best wishes for speedy recovery and happy life ahead.
Posts.Title: Surgery

Posts.Content: Best to have your DNA mapped and make sure you recv correct Chemo to find gene specific drug to attack your cancer.  Ask for bloodwork to profile/fingerprint your particular disease receptors to ensure you recv the right Chemo.   Also,  ask they take as few lymph nodes as possible as you don't want problems from lymphodema; science has proven taking more lymph nodes than necessary is very unwise due to problems with swelling/pain.  Evidence now shows no benefit in taking all lymph nodes.   I'm Stg 4 too, sure majority of site posters are as well...this can be treated. I have more than one spot---several on different areas of bone.   I am on Femara and Zometa...Femara by pill, side effects not too severe and the Zometa is by vein infusion e/5 wks...used to strengthen bone and keep cancer from further invasion.   You can read up.   Just be very careful with type of Chemo they try to give you, some are not useful in breast cancer and medical society has reputation of using what I call the "Shotgun Effect", just pepper the patient with all the ammunition (drugs)and hope something will hit the right spot...Insist they test your tumor for protein and gene abnormalties so you recv the correct drug, ask name and read up first to success rates, side effects, etc.     Laser Surgery is an option, at least ck it out, then call and discuss w/ doc there....he will talk to you (without charge).   He discussed and explained all to me several times before I even stepped foot in his office.   Don't end up on the "Wish I Had" and "Why Didn't I at least Try" list.    YOU are the most iimportant person in this play, shine, take the lead and step into the spotlight...it is all about YOU and you deserve the best care on the planet.  Just remember - you are NOT alone.  Wishing you all the best.
Posts.Title: Panic

Posts.Content: Need littlel more information.  Do you know what particular type cancer, DCIS, Triple Neg, Inflammatory,etc?  I assume since she has bone pain, and it is in fact, due to cancer rather than MS, she is Stage 4.  Have they actually said the back pain is met to bone from the cancer?  Many on site are Stage 4, don't despair, I'm Stage 4, doing very well.  For now, best she can do is pain med until a full assessment fromo testing, biopsy, etc.   Had she had her mamm's, anything found prior to visit to ER? Has she had MRI/Bone Scans, etc.  If she has invasion in her body there is much she can do.  I had mets everywhere, lungs, liver,basal cell, ribs, pelvis and spine.  I managed to rid all soft tumors in 3 months, then the ribs and pelvis and now working on my spine.  So, it will take time, but she can improve her situation.   Just continue to be there for her.  I have found DMSO does relieve some of the bone pain as well.  YOu can find the ball roll on for easy application.  Hope results are not as dyer as you suspect.  Will keep you in prayer and thought.
Posts.Title: Sis dx "Breast cancer with mets to bones."

Posts.Content: Hey - good for you!  Me too... Love Mercola's site.   I did the Kelmun protocol and completely obliterated all my tumor markers, they have been normal over a year now, doc nearly fainted when saw just how low.   Diet does work, as we know!  I keep a good ph neg, eat whole foods, fruit, juices, no sugar, soy or dairy due to the mucus that feeds cancer.   Amazing what a difference a good diet can do to repair immune system, it is the key to fighting the beast.  I'm still getting good readings since I stopped the Femara, went on Aromasin, was ok for awhile, then same pain set in; they are joint killers as well as hot flashes and other "funny" feeliings...so good to not have the hotties or joint pain, went on a long swim yesterday, good 250yards and had such good stamina, no way could have done that last year, too much joint pain.  I take B17/Laetrile, Apricot pitts daily for the cyanide effect to zap any stray cancer cells, but I think when I had the Laser treatment to get my tumor, Doc got all the lighted areas, nothing shows on scans now. U & I dx'd about same time, me, Jan/2011 Stg4DCIS...we can beat the beast.  I take phytoplankton which has krill, so guess it is helping as well.  So good to hear from you and others who know alternative is not a screwball regimine, when it's Stg4, surely wouldn't be playing with our lives.   I know for me I have made the right choice, my friend, DX'd same week as me died from Stg 3 DCIS last year, she had mastectomy, chemo/rads, scheduled reconstruction but started going downhill.....just too sad, God only knows how some can survive, I think my decision to go alternative far exceeded the poisons in chemo, I just couldn't go that route, but I do respect anyone's decision, it is very frightening to hear the word cancer,  God Bless us all....stay strong...blessings
Posts.Title: Breast/Bone Stage 4

Posts.Content: Wishing you all the best, know you are anxious.  Hope you had a chance to at least look at LaserBreastCancerSurgery.com to see if you'd rather go an easier route.  I know how the medical industry yanks us around and doesn't give options, but just looking at that site and watching the video might be worth your giving a call.  I was talking w/my friend who has been, as have I, and we always wonder why more people don't at least look for easier options....either way, wish you the best.  Just remember, they do use lasers for eyes, backsurgery, and lots of other surgeries, this is sooo easy, no pain, no cutting, no blood or chance of cancer cells escaping, plus you get to keep your breast and skip all the misery.  You are the center of attention, you make the decision, it's your body.   Prayers for a quick recovery....
Posts.Title: Surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Ryder, if you weren't a crying basket case, you'd probably be the exception.   I dare say all of us who have heard that dreaded "C" diagnosis have gone thru exactly what you are experiencing...it is so difficult to try to come to terms with the "unknown",  but hang in there, it will get better and you will find that you can indeed "LIVE" with cancer.   I am in the U.S.(GA), just returned back from MGH/Boston....the best ever, I still have big fight on my hands with my Stg4, but I really feel I am going to be in the survivor category when the ink is dry on the Survivor Page.   I've talked w/many survivors in much worse shape than myself, or your condition, several with 20+ yrs under their belt.   I opted for Laser Breast Surgery to have my partial mastectomy, so much easier than traditional surgery....no pain, no blood, no misery.   Now all I have to do is the follow up treatments as my cancer has metasted into bone & nodules.   Go to Laser Breast Cancer Surgery on line or Dr. Vincent Ansanelli and see if this would be easier for you, sure beats the misery of a scalpel.  My cancer in the breast is gone, clear margins and also had 5 lymph nodes removed. This center is fantastic and so glad I went there rather than thru hospital procedure for removal.    Know others are praying for you and keeping you in thought and wishing you all the best....just know what you are experiencing is very normal, miserable to go thru, but very normal.  Sending cheer and support.....
Posts.Title: Panic

Posts.Content: Hi dehrah - thought I had written the part regarding the numbness and general bone discomfort.  I've had severe osteo arthritis since early 90's, was Dx'd DCIS BC/Stg4 in Jan 2011, which, as Stg4, they assumed i'd had for at least two years, and then gave a year at most as I was covered in mets.  But no thanks to my diligence in having on time mammograms...they missed that one!  So - They still wanted to do mastectomy/remove the tumor/chemo/rads - NO tks.  I opted for Laser Surgery, found that even at Stg 4, laser can hi-lite all  the areas affected and zap most of the tumors that appear on Xrays and sonograms.  Since then i've done great, but alas, I'm one of the "so called cooks"  I opted for alternative, have to tell you, it's worked for me.  I have NO invasion anywhere in my body, even the mets to ribs/pelvis gone, only small spot remains in spine....and yes, it gives me a wallop at times.  I was on Xgeva and Femara, then switched from Femara to Aromasin, much easier on the body joints and bones. I also had the numbess and stinging in extremities, doc's just don't seem to want to admit it is either of these meds....but I am pretty sure one of the meds you are taking;  either the Femara or Xgeva is causing the numbess.   I had it. Had it bad.  Was driving long distance and had to ck into motel as could not hold wheel of car, had stopped an hour prior, but still no relief.  As of six mo's ago I just quit everything!   Last scan showed no deterioration, bloodwork still perfect, tumor markers have not risen, in fact were down couple more poiints.  I've been normal for over a year now.  I chosse to use Strontium to protect my bones, and to heck with the Aromasin or Femara, I had been taking Premarin for over 20 years, I'm in late 60's, very active, mtn climbing, danced for 30 years, then taught, excellent swimmer, lots of stamina, so I could not bear to be incapacitated.  The Aromasin, prior the Femara, had just put me in torment, I thought arthritis was bad, well those are a real " itch" .  To me, if I needed Premarin because I had NO estrogen, why do I need either the Femara or Aromasin to stop production of Estrogen if my body isn't making it???  Just seemed a bit ridiculous.  I'd had the tumor removed, nothing is showing in my body, so I don't think I've done anything foolsih.  I've done mounds of reading up on cancer and what I find is a bit ridiculous....most oncologists can't even tell you what cancer is, i'm so tired of the same old verse ' Well, it's lots of things' - well, for each person maybe, but what is my particular cancer???  I've found it is anaerobic, so only a balanced immune system will kill it and it will.   I'dhad a bad case of lyme disease - due to treking in the woods, back in late 80's, then that set me up for Chronic Fatigue, I know that was the destruction of my immune system, siince then i've gotten on a very good diet, did the Kelmun protocol, which I know got my tumor markers under control....and, they were over the moon.   So....maybe if you discuss w/your doc that the drugs are killing your body with pain they can find a rememdy....and my dear, Vicodin is not going to give you respite....DEMAND percocet   I've had prescription over a year, I do not abuse,  I take 1/2 in morning, then 1/2 around 2pm and anothere 1/2 before bedtime.   It can make a world of difference.   Some days I don't even need it, but if you do, do not be bashful.  I'm not a druggie, I've never done pot or any drug, never smoked a cigarette my entire life, maybe had 2 - 3 glasses of wine a YEAR, never touch alcohol....so, exercise your rigths, you live in that body, no one can know the pain but you!   Sending wishes for a big improvement, stay strong.   Blessings to you.
Posts.Title: Breast/Bone Stage 4

Posts.Content: Easy to get cancer out of soft tissue.  Go to Kelmun Protocol.  It does work.  I had many tumors, some 9mm, but constant use of Bkg soda/maple syrup (laugh all you want, but it works), will devour cancer - good to take a 75mg coated asprin, causes cancer cells to congregate together...know several people who have used, we're all doing well.  For mets to bone, cesium chloride, but you need the right cesium, must be pure & from good supplier- add strontium & other select minerals, rubidium, etc.   DMSO is good for pain, the rub on w/rollerball head works best.  Glad the news was good, just keep the info in an if needed compartment...
Posts.Title: Sis dx "Breast cancer with mets to bones."

Posts.Content: Hi, I have stg4/BC, also in my bones. Dx 2/11, had laser surgery partial mastectomy.  No way I could do the slice and dice and mutilation.  Got fantastic results, clear 2 in margins, no pain, no cutting, no disfigurement.  Scans showed ribs, pelvis and spine tumor, plus nodes in chest, and liver.   I started Zometa and Femara.  Of course told the 2 yr survival, maybe more w/trmt. Well, just had CT scan 6/6/11 - my doc shocked!  No involvment, all tumors disappeared, only one left on my spine and it is reduced 60%.  I've only been on Zometa & Femara 90 days prior to this last scan....but, I take lots of supplements that I feel help...especially the Curcumin/Tumeric and Indole3 with Carbinol, plus lots more....Also, don't give a figs seed what doc's or medical say, I do the Asparagus religiously....Green Giant or Organic canned, bring to boil, puree in blender, cool in ref, take 2 -3 tsps twice day, been doing this 5 mo's., Also take Bicarbonate Soda w/Honey or Maple Syrup (Maple Syrup usage needs cooking, so I use Honey), 1 part Bicarb to 3 parts Honey, 1 Tblsp twice daily.  Who knows, it won't kill me, and something sure worked.   I cannot believe, and neither could my oncologist, but i'm sitting pretty.  Will continue w/regimine and go for scan again in Jan or Feb.  Don't give up, but Don't be too quick with the chemo....once your immune system is destroyed with chemo, there is no going back, from all i've researched,  chemo doesn't really help breast cancer...do some research, only 2% chance, you'll do better with naturopathic, but must be your research and your choice.   Do read Suzanne Somers Book..Knockout.   Keep positive.
Posts.Title: stage 4 treatment

Posts.Content: While there are many "good & caring" onco docs out there, I find they all seem to have hearing problems; meaning they are always on Transmit and not on Receive.  They just don't listen....you have to be insistent and take control or they will treat you like a number and not a living child of God.   Already think they took too many lymph nodes since you only had two positives.  Ask what she means by"below".  Some chemo does not work on breast cancer,  can  destroy your immune system and if you go in remission, good, but lots of "ifs" if it should return....some chemo will not work on return. If you are post menopausal, you can use the Femara or newer pill forms to keep cancer at bay, no harsh side effects as chemo-no hairloss, upchugs, mouthsores, etc, plus you need a bone enhancer to keep cancer from further invading bone--- Zometa, a vien IV which takes 15-20 minutes once a month treatment, or Denosomub which is injection, also once month.   I had the laser surgery for my partial mastectomy, only 5 nodes remodes but they had pathology immediatley to test and 4pos and 5th neg so they stopped removing....hospitals/doc have the power to say "Well, we did what was best protocol", my question is "For whom"? It's  US on the operating table and not THEM.   Hopefully with only 2 positives you will have good outcome, but anytime bone is involved, as with me, you get bumped into that Stg4 category and tho it's the same ball game, the rules shift.   Wish I could be there with you, but be strong and don't be bashful to ask and have them explain any fruther procedures.    I'm now investigating IPT therapy for myself.  If my tumor numbers haven't come way down by Novemeber, i'm going for it.   USed in Europe and here, not covered by insurance, but it has a very high success rate and people walk away cancer free.    Re the drain for your lymph nodes....you need that drain for a week or so, why did she take it out so early?   It should be a small flexible strawlike tube, you can pull it yourself, I did mine.  Just keep it very clean (hydrogen peroxide) and keep bandaged.  Keep us posted.   we have to be each others' support team and just know you do have great support here and we do care.   Best to you.
